race.name: Vorraki
entries: Vorraki Traits

entries.name: Age
entries:
Vorraki reach maturity at 16 and live up
to 80 years, though many die young in the
brutal world of Concord City.

entries.name: Size
entries:
Vorraki are tall and powerfully built,
between 6’0” and 7’2”
. Your size is
Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Vision
entries:
You can see in dim light within 60 feet
as if it were bright light, and in
darkness as if it were dim light.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries:
When reduced to 0
HP but not killed outright, drop to 1
HP instead. (Once per long rest)

entries.name: Brute Precision
entries:
When making a Strength
(Athletics) check, double your
proficiency bonus. (Once per short or
long rest)

entries.name: Calculated Violence
entries:
Add your Strength
modifier to Initiative instead of
Dexterity.

entries.name: Commanding Presence
entries:
Gain proficiency
in Intimidation or Persuasion (your
choice).

entries.name: Tactical Efficiency
entries:
You can use the
Help action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Commanding Voice
entries:
Gain proficiency in
Insight.

entries.name: Intro
entries:
Born of conflict and bred for power, the
Vorraki were shaped not by kingdoms or
bloodlines, but by necessity. Their
bodies are a response to violence, their
culture a reaction to servitude. Once
foot soldiers, bodyguards, and enforcers—
now private security magnates, district
rulers, and the muscle behind every
throne in Concord City.
They were never meant to lead. But in a
city where fear is currency, power
answers to presence.
They’ve outgrown their chains, but
never forgotten the weight. From gang wars
to corporate coups, wherever someone
needs protecting—or eliminating—you’ll
find Vorraki. Their loyalty isn’t bought;
it’s negotiated. Their silence isn’t
passive; it’s calculated. Their brutality
isn’t reckless; it’s refined.

entries.name: Appearance
entries:
Vorraki bodies are built for imposition.
Towering and massive, they radiate
strength, their frames a harmony of bulk
and precision. Skin tones range from
charcoal to deep bronze, often marred by
scars worn like medals. Their muscles are
dense, honed, and reinforced by a rapid-
healing biology that’s kept many alive
through wounds that would fell others.
Their faces are often square and
symmetrical, with stern brows, broad jaws,
and piercing eyes that seem to assess
threats on instinct. Some adorn their
bodies with tattoos, surgical
enhancements, or military iconography, all
telling a story of allegiance, violence,
or loss.
Clothing varies—sleek armored suits for
the elite, streetwear with tactical flair
for enforcers, and old riot gear
retrofitted with private upgrades for
those still in the trenches. Whether in
silk or kevlar, a Vorraki’s style says
one thing: “Don’t test me.
”

entries.name: Culture & Identity
entries:
To be Vorraki is to know restraint and
readiness in equal measure. They are
taught not just how to fight, but when
not to. Their discipline is legendary,
their wrath unforgettable.
Unlike other species that form
traditional family structures, Vorraki
build crews, squads, and units. Loyalty is
earned, not assumed. Bonds are forged in
battle, not blood.
Though often employed as mercenaries,
bodyguards, and enforcers, many are
rising—starting their own firms, ruling
criminal districts, or becoming power
brokers in their own right. And when they
do? They remember who tried to keep them
beneath their boots.
Among their own, Vorraki value:
Discipline over chaos
Tactics over bravado
Unity over legacy
They do not romanticize their origins.
They weaponize them.

entries.name: Societal Roles
entries:
Most Concordians see the Vorraki as
muscle. But the truth is more complex.
They dominate not just physically, but
tactically—understanding urban conflict,
power structures, and enforcement
strategies better than anyone else.
Common roles include:
Private Security Contractors – Armed
and organized, often working for
multiple clients with shifting
allegiances.
District Judges – Ruling entire
neighborhoods with authority enforced
not by law, but by reputation.
Tacticians & Strategists – Designing
responses to insurgency, labor
uprisings, and black-market
interference.
Bodyguard Guild Masters – Providing
elite protection services to monarchs,
CEOs, and even rogue A.S.T.R.A.L.
agents—for the right price.
Some even enter corporate life—not as
subordinates, but as necessary evils—the
unspeaking threat standing behind the
boardroom chair.

entries.name: Naming Conventions
entries:
Given Names:
Blaze, Kray, Roka, Brunt, Vex, Daro,
Strix, Maul, Tasha, Varn, Zera, Nok
— PLAYTEST MATERIAL—RULES AND CONTENT MAY
EST MATERIAL—RULES AND CONTENT MAY CHANGE.
— PLAYTEST MATERIAL—RULES AND CONTENT MAY CHANGE.
PLAYTEST MATERIAL—RULES AND CONTENT MAY CHANGE.
— PLAYTEST MATERIAL—RULES AND CONTENT MAY CHANGE.
— PLAYTEST MATERIAL—RULES AND CONTE
Callsigns or Crew Titles (used like
surnames):
Ironshade – Known for silent operations
Grudgeborn – Never forgets a betrayal
Tenback – Has saved ten lives in the
field
Deadright – Never misses
Haulmark – Known for moving bodies or
goods no one else can
Onechain – The last surviving member of
their original crew
Examples:
Vex Grudgeborn, Tasha Deadright

entries.name: Life in the City
entries:
Concord City doesn’t work without the
Vorraki. They guard the elites, suppress
the riots, and erase the problems too
messy for diplomacy. No law enforcement
agency functions properly without Vorraki
muscle behind it. No corporation sleeps
soundly unless a Vorraki stands at the
door.
And while the elite keep them close,
they never keep them controlled. Every
deal with a Vorraki comes with a whisper:
“What happens when they stop taking
orders?”

race.name: Weftifeles
entries: Weftifeles Traits

entries.name: Appearance
entries:
The Aestari are the very embodiment of refinement, their forms sculpted with an almost unnatural precision. Their beauty is undeniable, yet there is something unsettling about their symmetry—something too perfect, too deliberate. Every aspect of their appearance suggests careful design rather than natural evolution.

Their skin tones span a striking spectrum, from porcelain white to deep onyx, often carrying an unnatural smoothness. Some Aestari seem to shimmer faintly under artificial light, their complexions subtly shifting to match their surroundings. Their hair is equally extraordinary, flowing in shades of platinum, jet black, blood-red, or even metallic hues like silver, gold, or copper. It moves as if weightless, resisting the effects of wind and gravity in ways that defy explanation.

The most distinctive feature of the Aestari, however, is their eyes. Reflective like polished glass, their irises capture and refract light in strange ways, often glowing softly in dim environments. In neon-lit cityscapes, their gaze mirrors the filtered lights around them, shifting in color and intensity. Even in darkness, their eyes gleam with an unnatural radiance, making it impossible to ignore their presence.

Their physiques, while varied, always retain an air of elegance. Whether towering and statuesque or lean and wiry, their movements are deliberate—measured, efficient, and impossibly smooth. Some seem to glide rather than walk, their steps unnaturally silent. Others hold themselves with an effortless poise, commanding attention without a single wasted motion.

Though their outward forms radiate perfection, there is an eerie lack of imperfections. No blemishes, no stray hairs, no idle fidgeting. Their expressions are precise, their emotions calculated. Even their breath seems regulated, each inhale and exhale controlled. It is this very flawlessness that makes them unsettling—an uncanny beauty that feels just a little too engineered.

To the untrained eye, the Aestari may seem like an elite class of humans, their presence exuding wealth, power, and control. But look closer, and the differences become clear. Their elegance is not just aesthetic—it is fundamental, woven into the very core of their being. Whether they were shaped by natural evolution or something else entirely remains a mystery, but one thing is certain:

The Aestari are not like the others.

entries.name: Culture & Identity
entries:
The Aestari are a species shaped not by nature, but by control. Every aspect of their existence is carefully maintained, cultivated like a living masterpiece. Where others see adaptation as survival, the Aestari see it as refinement—a means of perfecting themselves in both form and function.

They thrive in environments where power is concentrated, where hierarchy and influence dictate existence. In towering corporate spires, arcane enclaves, and palatial estates, the Aestari flourish as both architects and rulers of society. Their culture is steeped in elitism, built upon generations of meticulous self-improvement, both physically and intellectually.

Despite their seeming unity, the Aestari do not form monolithic societies. Instead, they align themselves into syndicates, noble houses, and ideological sects, each refining their own interpretations of perfection. These groups operate like exclusive circles,

The Aestari are a species shaped not by nature, but by control. Every aspect of their existence is carefully maintained, cultivated like a living masterpiece. Where others see adaptation as survival, the Aestari see it as refinement—a means of perfecting themselves in both form and function.

They thrive in environments where power is concentrated, where hierarchy and influence dictate existence. In towering corporate spires, arcane enclaves, and palatial estates, the Aestari flourish as both architects and rulers of society. Their culture is steeped in elitism, built upon generations of meticulous self-improvement, both physically and intellectually.

Despite their seeming unity, the Aestari do not form monolithic societies. Instead, they align themselves into syndicates, noble houses, and ideological sects, each refining their own interpretations of perfection. These groups operate like exclusive circles,

shaping the world through influence, commerce, and political maneuvering rather than direct conquest.

Beneath their composed exteriors, however, there lies an unspoken fear—a lingering paranoia that their elegance is a slowly fading illusion. With their reliance on artificial environments and selective breeding, some Aestari whisper of a decline—of something breaking beneath the surface of their curated existence. Yet none dare speak such thoughts aloud, for to do so would be to acknowledge imperfection.

entries.name: Societal Roles
entries:
Among the Aestari, one’s function defines status. The roles they adopt are not merely professions but expressions of identity, meticulously chosen to suit their strengths and ambitions. While outsiders may see them as cold or calculating, the Aestari view their structured society as a work of art—each individual a carefully placed stroke on the canvas of civilization.

Arbiters of Influence: The highest echelon of Aestari society consists of strategists, diplomats, and financiers. They do not govern openly but control the systems that shape reality—economic structures, magical pacts, and political dealings. Their words are law, not by decree, but by the sheer weight of their presence.

Curators of Perfection: Aestari artisans, scholars, and geneticists work tirelessly to refine their species, crafting everything from philosophical treatises on beauty to biological enhancements that sustain their immaculate appearances. To them, the pursuit of mastery is not merely academic—it is sacred.

Ghosts of the Halls: Some Aestari embrace the art of being unseen. These are the spymasters, enforcers, and assassins, those who operate in shadows but never linger in them. Their existence is a contradiction—both invisible and unforgettable, the whisper of a name that cannot be traced.

The Untouched: Among the elite, there exists a sect of Aestari who reject labor entirely. Their role is to exist as paragons, symbols of their species’ supremacy. These figures—whether nobility, figureheads, or deified corporate scions—are untouchable, above the concerns of mortality.

Regardless of their place in the hierarchy, all Aestari share a singular philosophy: to falter is to be forgotten.

entries.name: Naming Conventions
entries:
Aestari names reflect their obsession with elegance, tradition, and control. Their naming conventions are built on symmetry, soft consonants, and flowing syllables. Each name is chosen with intent—whether to convey power, refinement, or an impression of mystique.

Traditional Names:
These names are fluid, carrying a melodic quality that seems purposefully cultivated to linger in the mind. Many Aestari prefer longer, flowing names that sound as if they belong to a lineage of consequence.

Examples: Caelithar, Orisyn, Veythiel, Lysara, Xalendir, Sylthorin, Naevara.
Modern Aestari Names:
In contemporary circles, some Aestari adopt names that blend seamlessly into high society, evoking refinement, charm, and quiet authority. These names often have soft vowels, flowing syllables, and a hint of aristocratic elegance.

Examples: Adrian, Lucien, Sylas, Julian, Victor, Cassian, Evander, Dorian, Alistair, Raphael
For feminine names: Celeste, Liliane, Seraphine, Evelyne, Selene, Vivienne, Ophelia, Isadora, Camilla, Elise
Surnames & House Names:
Over generations, many Aestari surnames have faded, lost to time or deliberately shed as their holders sought to redefine themselves. Some still retain their ancestral house names, while others have adopted sleek, modern surnames that blend effortlessly into contemporary high society.

Common Surnames: Many Aestari have taken on surnames that feel refined but understated, subtly hinting at lineage without the weight of old traditions.
Examples: Voss, Calloway, DaCosta, Alden, Mercer, Durant, Faulkner, Lennox, Sinclair, Everard, Marquette
House Names:
The few Aestari who still claim their noble heritage often retain their house names, which still carry the resonance of old power and deep tradition. These names are often longer, more ornate, and evoke the classical elegance of their culture.

Examples: Val’Kaeron, Orthelias, Sythrin, Vel’Thalor, Elaris, Ael’Veyr, Zarentis, Caelthorne, Lysandral, Vor’Tyrian
Naming Conventions:
Many Aestari use both their modern surname and house name when signing official documents or presenting themselves formally, a nod to both pragmatism and legacy.

Example: Adrian Voss of House Vel’Thalor
Example: Liliane Calloway of House Orthelias

subclass.name: Ghost of Sablemarche
subclassFeatures: Erase the Trace|Covert Agent|EverydayGuidetoConcordCity|Ghost of Sablemarche |EverydayGuidetoConcordCity|10|EverydayGuidetoConcordCity

spell.name: Ashen Breath
entries: You exhale a puff of grayish smoke, which spreads in a small cone before quickly vanishing. Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw or briefly choke on the acrid air. On a failed save, a creature cannot take reactions until the start of its next turn. This effect does not work against creatures that do not need to breathe.

spell.name: Blink and You Missed It
entries:
You momentarily sync out of step with the immediate flow of time, creating a minor delay in perception.
 
Until the start of your next turn:
- Creatures that would notice you must make an Intelligence saving throw or fail to recall any details about your presence until you interact with them directly.
- If you attack or speak, the effect immediately ends for that creature.

spell.name: Cauterize Through Time
entries:
You snap your fingers through folded chronology, sending a burning ripple backward into a wound that never had time to close.
Choose one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 pyric damage (a combination of radiant and fire), and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer Disadvantage on their next Concentration check before the end of your next turn.

- 5th level – 2d6 damage
- 11th level – 3d6 damage
- 17th level – 4d6 damage

spell.name: Ceiling Watcher
entries: A barely visible eye- like shape appears on a ceiling, wall, or corner of a room. The illusion remains for the duration but does not actually perceive anything. Creatures unfamiliar with the spell must make a Wisdom (Perception) check to determine that it is not real. If they fail, they instinctively avoid looking at it or standing beneath it.

spell.name: Cinder Veil
entries: A faint shimmer of embers rises around you, warding off the cold. Until the start of your next turn, you ignore the first 5 cold damage you would take. If you are in an area of magical darkness, the veil glows faintly, revealing your silhouette to creatures within 5 feet.

spell.name: Clockless Chess
entries: Summons an enchanted chessboard where the pieces move themselves. Unfortunately, the game always ends in a stalemate.

spell.name: Conjure Mild Inconvenience
entries:
You summon a trivial but deeply irritating inconvenience to plague a creature or small area within range. No damage is dealt, and no serious harm is inflicted—just mild frustration.

Roll a d10 and consult the Chaos Table below to determine the exact annoyance:
Clarifications:- The inconvenience is purely cosmetic, causing no damage or severe disadvantage.- The DM can creatively adjust minor details based on the narrative scenario.

| d10 | Minor Annoyance (Chaos Table) |
|----- |----------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1 | A sock disappears from the target’s foot, never to be found again. |
| 2 | A sudden, unbearable itch appears exactly where the target can't reach. |
| 3 | The target’s shoelaces immediately untie themselves repeatedly for 1 minute. |
| 4 | A random book or document the target is holding becomes incorrectly labeled, causing confusion. |
| 5 | The target’s keys or similar small celebrityl item vanish momentarily, reappearing only after thorough searching. |
| 6 | An annoying dripping sound emanates nearby but has no identifiable source. |
| 7 | The target’s clothes become slightly uncomfortable—too itchy, tight, or loose—for exactly one minute. |
| 8 | A persistent and unexplained humming noise surrounds the target, audible only to them. |
| 9 | Every surface the target touches for the next minute feels oddly sticky. |
| 10 | A harmless but persistent fly or insect buzzes around the target’s face, impossible to swat or catch. |

spell.name: Crawling Dread
entries: You weave a subtle illusion into the mind of a creature within range, causing them to feel an unnatural crawling sensation on their skin. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature spends its next bonus action, if it has one, brushing at unseen shapes or shifting uncomfortably. This effect ends early if they take damage.

spell.name: Dead Air
entries: You disrupt sound waves in a localized area. Until the start of your next turn, all spoken words within range are slightly distorted, causing messages to come out garbled and difficult to understand. If cast near a radio or intercom, the device crackles with static for one round.

spell.name: Dice Storm
entries:
You call upon the fractured laws of probability, summoning a swirling rain of polyhedral objects—tiny magical dice—within a 10- foot radius centered on you. The clattering projectiles slam into everything nearby.

Each creature of your choice in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 impact damage. On a successful save, they take half damage. The damage is nonlethal unless otherwise specified.

Chaos Surge:

Immediately after casting, roll a d20. On a natural 20, the dice manifest as larger and denser projectiles (e.g., d20s the size of coconuts). Choose one of the following critical effects, or let the DM improvise:- The target is knocked prone.- One object in the area is crushed or broken.- A random magical effect is triggered (see Wild Magic surge table).- The area becomes difficult terrain until the end of your next turn (covered in slippery dice).- You regain 1 hit point (the dice land just right to boost your morale).

Originally cataloged under “d1.ce” by A.S.T.R.A.L., this anomaly manifested during a failed probability containment test. The storm is still considered a Class- 1 hazard in casinos, board rooms, and office game nights.

spell.name: Directional Sense
entries: You focus your senses, allowing the pulse of magic to resonate through the terrain around you. This pulse reveals the optimal path forward, guiding your movements with precision. Whether in dense forests, city streets, or endless hallways, the flow of magic sharpens your awareness of the shortest and safest route.- Effect:- For the duration of the spell, you gain the ability to automatically find the shortest path to your desired destination within range. This can be a physical route, avoiding obstacles like walls or difficult terrain, or identifying pathways hidden or obscured by illusion magic.- You do not become disoriented or confused by labyrinths, mazes, or other disorienting environments.

The flow of energy pulses through the stone beneath your feet, and your senses expand beyond your immediate surroundings. As the pulse of magic spreads outward, the shifting walls of a labyrinth reveal their true layout, and you are guided with an unnatural certainty toward your destination.

spell.name: Dirge Pulse
entries: You release a low, resonant tone that only the dying can hear. Any creature within range that is at 0 hit points and making death saving throws automatically stabilizes if it succeeds on its next death saving throw. If an undead creature is within range, it takes 1 cognitive damage as the resonance disrupts its form.

spell.name: Doppler Sound
entries: You attune yourself to the subtle shifts in the air, using the ambient sounds of the environment to perceive the movement of creatures around you. Through the echoes in the terrain, you sense the direction and speed of any creature moving within range.- Effect:- You can detect the direction and speed of any creature within 60 feet that is moving. This allows you to sense their general movement, such as whether they are approaching, retreating, or moving laterally.- You cannot detect the exact position, but you can pinpoint the movement relative to your position.

As you focus on the sounds around you, the once- faint hum of the environment sharpens into something more defined. The echoes in the subway tiles vibrate with subtle patterns, giving you an almost instinctual understanding of what is moving around you, where they are headed, and how fast they are traveling.

spell.name: Drifting Echo
entries:
You release a thin pulse of sound, inaudible to the living, but receptive to echoes of the past.
 
For the duration, you can hear vague, distorted murmurs of events that occurred in the area within the past hour. These sounds are indistinct and fragmented but may provide clues about recent conversations, movement, or disturbances.

The clarity of the echo depends on an Intelligence (Investigation) check made against your spell save DC:

spell.name: Dripping Hour
entries: Time fractures briefly around a small object of your choice within range. A flickering afterimage of the object appears where it was exactly one second ago, causing momentary confusion. A creature interacting with the object must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or be unable to distinguish which version is real until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Dust Veil
entries: A sudden gust of dust rises from the ground, swirling around you in a blinding veil. The particles obscure your form, making it harder for enemies to land a blow.- Effect:- When you are attacked, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll against you for the duration of the round.- The dust is drawn from the terrain, and the effect is strongest in areas where the environment is gritty or decaying (such as crumbling concrete).

As you step, the ground beneath you cracks and a cloud of dust erupts into the air, swirling around your form in a cloud of obscurity. The air feels thick with sand as your enemies struggle to focus through the haze, their vision distorted by the fine particles swirling in every direction.

spell.name: Echo of the Lost
entries: You briefly attune yourself to lingering impressions of the past. You hear a single whispered sentence in a language you understand, spoken by a creature that was in the area within the past 24 hours. The sentence is random, chosen by the DM, and may or may not be useful. If no creature was in the area within that time, you instead hear a distant, meaningless murmur.

| DC Range | Effect Description |
|---|---|
| 10 or lower | Incoherent murmurs, difficult to interpret. |
| 11–15 | Disjointed words or partial sentences. |
| 16+ | A full phrase or clear statement relevant to the past event. |

spell.name: Echo of the Overheard
entries: By attuning to the residual vibrations in the air, you briefly hear a snippet of a conversation that took place in the area within the last 10 minutes. The words are often out of context, distorted, or incomplete, requiring interpretation.

spell.name: Echoing Stomp
entries:
You stomp your foot with great force, sending a shockwave reverberating through the wooden floor beneath you. The sound echoes with a force that temporarily disrupts your enemies.
- Effect:
- All creatures within a 10- foot radius must make a Constitution saving throw.
- On a failed save, creatures lose their reaction until the start of their next turn, stunned by the reverberation of the stomp.
- Creatures that fail the saving throw also take 1d6 sonic damage as the shockwave disrupts their senses.

You stamp your foot firmly, and the floor trembles as the shockwave ripples outward, vibrating through the wood like the crack of thunder. The deafening echo unsettles your foes, leaving them dazed and vulnerable, as the ground beneath them seems to tremble with your power.

spell.name: Eclipse Touch
entries: You trace an arcane sigil over a creature’s skin, leaving behind a barely perceptible shimmer. The next time the target takes chiaric damage before the start of your next turn, the damage is reduced by 1d4.

spell.name: Erased Footsteps
entries: You alter the way a surface registers footprints. For the duration, a touched floor, rug, or dirt path erases any traces of movement within a 5- foot radius. Creatures attempting to track someone through this area must make a Wisdom (Survival) check against your spell save DC.

spell.name: Expired Authority
entries: For a fleeting moment, a creature within range instinctively hesitates, doubting its own authority. If the target is attempting to enforce a rule, issue a command, or exert influence over another creature, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or momentarily second- guess itself, delaying its action until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Fabricated Memory
entries: By momentarily altering a minor cognitive detail, you cause a creature to misremember something trivial. It might forget setting its keys down, misplace an item it was just holding, or recall an insignificant interaction that never happened. The effect is fleeting, lasting only a few seconds before the mind corrects itself.

spell.name: Faint Heartbeat
entries: You attune your senses to the fading echoes of life. You become aware of the heartbeat of any creature within range, even if they are hidden or invisible, as long as they are not undead or a construct. You do not learn their exact location, only their presence.

spell.name: Fascination
entries:
A subdermal neurological impulse is implanted in the target’s cognitive prioritization center, making them incapable of focusing on anything but the caster.

The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save:

- The affected target follows the caster wherever they go, unable to take their eyes off them.
- If attacked, the target enters a berserk fury, attacking anyone who obstructs their pursuit of the caster (+1 to hit,- 1 AC).
- The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Faulty Wiring
entries: You send a small jolt of paranormal static into an electronic device or light source. A radio emits garbled voices, a neon sign flickers erratically, or a speaker lets out a burst of unintelligible noise. If cast on a security camera, it glitches for one round, distorting any footage.

spell.name: Filing Error
entries: For an instant, a piece of paper, card, or document within range appears misfiled, smudged, or incorrectly labeled. Any creature attempting to reference it must make an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to notice the anomaly. The effect fades once examined closely.

spell.name: Flickering Veil
entries: You momentarily distort your presence, causing your form to flicker like a mirage. Until the start of your next turn, attack rolls against you have disadvantage if the attacker relies on sight. If you move on your turn, you leave behind a faint afterimage that vanishes after 1 round.

spell.name: Ghost Slap
entries:
A haptic force field momentarily materializes, delivering a sharp, percussive impact to a target. The sensation is startling but harmless, designed to elicit attention, dominance, or playful reprimand.
 
- If the target fails a Wisdom saving throw, they experience a moment of flustered distraction, causing disadvantage on their next attack roll or ability check.
- If the target is affected by Ghost Slap, it has disadvantage on the next saving throw against a Necromancy spell cast before the end of your next turn.
- Frequently used in advanced social dominance training protocols and high- end recreational services.

spell.name: Glassheart
entries: As your attacker lands a devastating blow, your form momentarily fractures like glass. The critical hit is reduced to a normal hit, but you take an additional 1d4 cognitive damage from the strain.

spell.name: Glitch Step
entries: With a sudden shift in perception, you instinctively navigate the reality around you, stepping through the digital distortion of space.- Effect:- You teleport up to 5 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.- The movement is instantaneous and silent, as if the very architecture of the world is bending around you.- This effect can be used to bypass difficult terrain or to avoid attacks of opportunity, but only for the distance specified.

As your foot leaves the ground, the world around you briefly flickers, as if a digital surface has been hacked. For an instant, the space around you glitches, and you are teleported to a new position, slipping through the cracks of reality itself. You reappear with an eerie, unnatural smoothness, like a bug in a program.

spell.name: Grasp of the Unseen
entries:
A spectral, invisible hand momentarily grips an object or creature within range.

- If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.
- If the target is an unattended object, you can pull it 10 feet toward you or away from you.

The hand disappears immediately after the effect occurs.

spell.name: Gutterwake
entries: You awaken the filth of the streets. Puddles ripple, dust rises, and refuse shifts unnaturally in a 15- foot cone originating from you. Creatures within range must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be briefly disoriented by the sudden movement, causing them to have disadvantage on the next opportunity attack they make before the end of their next turn. If cast in an area with significant debris or liquid, you can instead create a fleeting image or pattern in the grime, which lasts for 1 minute.

spell.name: Hesitation Protocol
entries: An unseen force invokes bureaucratic inertia, subtly clouding a creature’s resolve. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it briefly questions its course of action, subtracting 1d4 from its attack roll.

spell.name: Hollow Gaze
entries: Your eyes darken as you channel a sliver of the void’s presence. One creature of your choice within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or feel an unnatural chill creeping over them. Until the start of your next turn, the creature has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks, and if it is concentrating on a spell, it must make a concentration check against your spell save DC.

spell.name: Hollow Stare
entries:
Your gaze locks onto a creature, unnervingly hollow, as though reality has forgotten how to render your features.
 
- The target makes a Charisma saving throw.
- On a failure, they experience a momentary existential lapse, losing 1d4 Intelligence (minimum 1) until the end of their next turn.
- If they fail by 5 or more, their next spoken sentence is misheard by all creatures except the caster, as if reality "mistranscribed" it.

spell.name: Insulated Surge
entries: The magical properties of rubberized flooring wrap around you, providing an insulating shield against electrical energy.- Effect:- For the duration of the spell, you gain resistance to electric damage, reducing any electric damage you take by half.- This resistance applies to any electric damage dealt to you from sources such as spells, traps, or environmental effects.

The floor beneath you vibrates with a subtle hum as the air around you shimmers. With a swift motion, you tap into the insulating magic of the rubberized surface beneath, creating a protective barrier that shields you from incoming electric currents. The warmth of the shield pulses around you, and for the duration, any lightning strikes are absorbed by the magical field, leaving you unharmed.

spell.name: Jagged Step
entries:
You propel a jagged shard of wood or stone from the ground beneath you, causing it to strike nearby enemies.- Effect:- You create a jagged splinter from the broken tiles or surrounding terrain, hurling it at a target within 5 feet of you.
- Each creature within 5 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d6 tearing damage from the jagged splinter.
- On a successful save, the creature takes half damage (round down).
- The spell also creates a minor dangerous terrain effect, causing any creatures in the affected area to take 1 point of tearing damage if they step within the 5- foot radius until the start of your next turn.

You stomp your foot firmly on the cracked tiles, your body drawing on the surrounding debris, and with a sudden flick of your wrist, you summon the jagged shard of wood, rock, or broken tile to strike out at those nearby. The sharp splinter of the earth rattles, leaving a dangerous trail in its wake, and for a moment, the ground beneath you seems alive with jagged intent.

spell.name: Lantern of the Forgotten
entries: You conjure a spectral lantern hovering at your shoulder, flickering with an eerie, bluish glow. The lantern sheds dim light in a 30- foot radius, but only the caster and hollow creatures can see it. If an hollow creature enters the light, it must make a Wisdom saving throw or become unable to willingly move out of the light’s radius for 1 minute. A creature that succeeds on the save is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

spell.name: Log
entries:
Creates a single, perfectly ordinary log within 50 feet of the caster. Despite its unremarkable appearance, the log radiates a strange aura of importance. Roll on the Log Essence Table to determine its wood type and subtle vibe.

The caster may sit on it, wield it as an improvised weapon (1d4 impact), or simply admire its pure log- ness.

| d8 | Log Essence |
|---- |---------------------------------- |
| 1 | Oak – Solid, dependable, mildly judgmental. |
| 2 | Pine – Smells great but sheds needles constantly. |
| 3 | Birch – Pale, elegant, oddly smooth to the touch. |
| 4 | Mahogany – Impossibly classy. You feel underdressed. |
| 5 | Driftwood – Damp, salty, and whispers ancient secrets. |
| 6 | Petrified – Heavy, stone- like, cold and eternal. |
| 7 | Hollow – Echoes slightly when tapped. Creepy. |
| 8 | Fierywood – Warm to the touch. Never burns. |

spell.name: Lurking Gloom
entries: You conjure a flicker of clinging darkness that momentarily lingers in the air. One creature of your choice within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or feel a wave of unnatural cold, reducing its passive Perception by 5 until the end of its next turn. If cast in dim light or darkness, the effect is automatically successful.

spell.name: Mage Sand
entries: The caster conjures a small pile of golden sand in their palm. It has no magical properties but remains permanently damp. Scholars have debated its significance for centuries, yet it remains as pointless as ever. Additional Effects: nan

spell.name: Magnetic Grip
entries: Your feet become magnetized, securing you firmly to steel surfaces, providing enhanced stability against physical manipulation.- Effect:- You gain advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks to resist being shoved or knocked prone.- While the spell is active, you cannot be moved against your will by physical means unless the creature pushing you succeeds on a Strength (Athletics) check against your Strength saving throw DC.- The magnetic effect only works on steel or similarly magnetic surfaces (e.g., metal floors, steel grates, etc.).

You feel the ground beneath you hum as the magic takes hold. A faint magnetic pull runs through the soles of your feet, anchoring you to the steel beneath you. You brace yourself, standing firm against the force trying to knock you over, as you become one with the steel underfoot. The pull grows stronger with every movement, keeping you solidly in place.

spell.name: Misfiled Presence
entries: For a brief moment, reality forgets you. You become difficult to track—mundane security cameras blur your image, paperwork listing your location misprints, and witnesses second- guess seeing you. You do not become invisible, but creatures attempting to recall details about you must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.

spell.name: Missing Ledger
entries: You cause a single nonmagical item no larger than a book to appear misplaced or absent to those unfamiliar with it. For the duration, creatures other than you must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to notice the object. This effect ends if the item is touched directly.

spell.name: Momentum Shockwave
entries: You slam your foot down onto the ground, sending a controlled shockwave rippling through the asphalt, knocking foes back and disrupting their balance.- Saving Throw: Each creature within 5 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw.- On a failed save, the creature is pushed 5 feet away from you.- On a successful save, the creature remains unaffected by the shockwave.- Additionally, any creature that fails the saving throw takes 1d6 sound damage as the shockwave disturbs their equilibrium.

You slam your foot onto the solid asphalt beneath you, a tremor spreading out in all directions. The ground rumbles briefly before an invisible wave of force ripples outward, sending those nearby stumbling backward, unbalanced by the shock. The sound of the wave echoes briefly in the air, leaving a brief ringing in the ears of those it affects.

spell.name: Mothlight
entries: A small, glowing orb resembling a moth flutters within range, pulsing dim light in a 10- foot radius. The orb moves slowly (10 feet per round) in a direction of your choice. If it enters a creature’s space, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw or be briefly mesmerized, reducing its movement speed by half until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Mystic Mussel
entries:
You conjure a small, ancient mussel in your hand—enchanted, annoyed, and tightly sealed shut. If anyone tries to pry it open, it vanishes with a faint salty pop, leaving behind only a briny scent.

If spoken to gently and respectfully, the mussel may whisper a cryptic phrase in an ancient tongue or forgotten accent. These utterances are rarely useful and often nonsense, though occasionally they align with bizarre truths.

Once conjured, the mussel lasts for 1 minute or until it disappears. It may be placed on surfaces, used as a very passive familiar, or simply admired.

| d6 | Whispered Phrase |
|---- |------------------------------------------- |
| 1 | The seventh bell tolls sideways. |
| 2 | Ask the chimney, it remembers. |
| 3 | You were almost someone else. |
| 4 | Don’t trust the paperclip. |
| 5 | Salt forgets, but pepper never forgives. |
| 6 | It’s already behind you. |

spell.name: Opulent Glare
entries: You cause a dazzling flash of light to reflect off a nearby surface, like polished marble, momentarily blinding and disorienting any ranged attacker.- Saving Throw: Each creature within a 30- foot radius who makes a ranged attack on their turn must make a Constitution saving throw.- On a failed save, the creature suffers disadvantage on their next ranged attack.- On a successful save, they are unaffected by the dazzling light.

The marble gleams brightly in the light as you invoke the magic, reflecting the sunlight or torchlight in an intense flash. The sudden burst causes ranged attackers to squint, their aim faltering as the brilliance momentarily overwhelms their senses. Those who fail to resist the burst of light find themselves momentarily disoriented, struggling to regain focus before releasing their projectile.

spell.name: Oxidized Strike
entries: You channel the corrosive forces of decay into your strike, touching a creature’s armor or weapon with a touch imbued with necrotic energy. The target suffers both chiaric damage and the physical degradation of their gear.- Melee spell attack: Make a melee spell attack against a target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 chiaric damage.- Armor Degradation: If the target is wearing armor, their AC is reduced by 1 for 1 minute due to rust and corrosion weakening their armor. This reduction stacks with other effects.- Weapon Degradation: If the target is wielding a weapon, it becomes slightly dulled, imposing disadvantage on attack rolls with that weapon until it is repaired or restored.

As you reach out with a swipe or strike, you feel the cold, creeping touch of decay course through your hand, an invisible corrosive aura eating away at the target’s defenses. Where you touch, rust and rot spread in an instant, weakening armor and weapon alike. Your victim recoils as the rust spreads across their equipment, their movements becoming sluggish and uncertain.

spell.name: Pale Effigy
entries: You create a faint, distorted trace of someone who recently handled an object. A ghostly outline of their hands or footprints lingers faintly, fading slowly over the duration. This effect does not reveal the person’s identity but may suggest their presence.

spell.name: Paper Trail
entries: You gain vague insight into the bureaucratic history of an object or document you touch. If it was ever officially filed, cataloged, or stamped, you receive a faint impression of where and when. This does not reveal detailed information but might hint at ownership, classification, or if it has been misplaced.

spell.name: Poltergust
entries:
You gesture subtly, and a phantasmal breeze whispers through an area you can see within range. Curtains billow, candles flicker, papers shift, and cold air brushes the skin. Though entirely illusory, the sensation feels real—enough to distract, unnerve, or suggest a presence unseen.- The wind cannot cause harm or move objects heavier than 5 lbs.- Creatures within the area instinctively glance around. If they are unaware of you or expecting stealth, you may gain advantage on your next Charisma (Deception or Performance) or Dexterity (Stealth) check against them before the end of your next turn.

This 0- Cantrip is often used to haunt, mislead, or emphasize one’s words, and is popular among illusionists, tricksters, and dramatists alike.

spell.name: Psyblade
entries:
You conjure a shimmering blade of psychic energy in your hand, forged from your focused will. Choose any melee weapon form you are proficient with (no ammunition or thrown weapons). The Psyblade takes that shape but is weightless, emits faint mental whispers, and deals force damage instead of its usual type.

You can use your Wisdom modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls with this weapon.

The damage die starts at 1d4 and improves as you gain Psionic levels, following the Monk’s Martial Arts die:

Additional Properties:
- The blade vanishes if it leaves your hand, if you cast this spell again, or if you dismiss it (no action required).
- The Psyblade is magical, counts as a spellcasting focus, and can be used as the delivery method for Psionic Cantrips.
- When you take the Attack action, you may forgo one attack to cast a Psionic cantrip through the blade, targeting the same creature.

### Psyblade Damage Die Progression

| Psionic Level | Psyblade Damage Die |
|--------------- |---------------------- |
| 1–4 | 1d4 |
| 5–10 | 1d6 |
| 11–16 | 1d8 |
| 17+ | 1d10 |

spell.name: Mindsling
entries:
You form a sharpened shard of mental force—an arrow of intent, a spike of memory, or a piercing thought—and hurl it toward a creature within range.

Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 cognitive damage.

The shard is invisible to those without psychic sensitivity, leaving no physical trace. To mundane observers, the effect may resemble the target momentarily flinching or losing focus.

Thematic Delivery

You choose the form your psyslings take. Examples include:
- A crystalline memory dart
- A shimmering synaptic spike
- A phrase spoken backward that drills through thought
- A fractal glyph burned across the air

The number of shards you manifest increases as you gain levels.
Each shard can target the same or different creatures. You make a separate attack roll for each.

### Psysling Cantrip Progression

| Character Level | Damage | Number of Shards |
|----------------- |-------- |------------------ |
| 1st | 1d8 | 1 |
| 5th | 1d8 | 2 |
| 11th | 1d8 | 3 |
| 17th | 1d8 | 4 |

spell.name: Pummel Stone
entries:
You summon a chunk of stone or brick from the earth beneath you, hurling it toward a target with magical force. The rocky projectile strikes with an explosive impact.- Ranged spell attack: Make a ranged spell attack against a target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 impact damage from the stone.- The target must make a Strength saving throw (DC equals your spellcasting ability modifier) or be knocked prone by the force of the impact.

- 5th level: The damage increases to 2d8 impact, and the range of the spell increases to 60 feet.- 11th level: The spell deals 3d8 impact damage, and the target is stunned until the end of their next turn on a failed saving throw.

You kneel, tapping the earth beneath you, and with a surge of magical force, rip a jagged brick or cobblestone from the ground. With a swift motion, you hurl it at your foe, the stone sailing through the air with unnatural speed and power. The target is struck with the weight and force of the earth itself.

spell.name: Radiant Shine
entries: You call upon divine radiance to flare from the gilded surface of the marble beneath you. The bright light sears those standing within its glow, casting shadows in the wake of its divine fury.- Creatures within 10 feet of the gilded marble or any surface you choose to target must make a Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 chiaric damage.- Creatures that fail their saving throw are also blinded until the end of their next turn, as the radiant light temporarily overwhelms their vision.

You place the gold- plated coin on the floor, and radiant beams burst from the gilded marble surface, creating an intense, divine shine that floods the area. Enemies caught in its glow feel the burning light sear their skin, and their vision is blinded by the brilliance.

spell.name: Rail Arc
entries: You channel a burst of static energy through nearby metal tracks, causing them to discharge a violent arc of electricity. The electric current surges through the rails, shocking any creature in proximity.- Creatures within 10 feet of any metal track or rail you target must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 electric damage.- If the target is wearing metal armor or wielding metal weapons, they take an additional 1d6 electric damage due to the conductive properties of the metal.

You press your palm to the rail and a crackling surge of electricity courses through the metal, causing the nearby train tracks to hum with power. A jolt of lightning arcs from the tracks, discharging across the area and shocking any creatures foolish enough to be standing nearby. The sound of crackling energy fills the air as static builds.

spell.name: Redacted Statement
entries: You distort a single spoken word, causing it to be completely omitted from a sentence. This does not change meaning but leaves an obvious gap, as if the speaker momentarily forgot the word or it was intentionally censored. If used against a spellcaster, their spell is unaffected, but they experience a brief moment of dissonance.

spell.name: Resonant Clang
entries: You focus the sound of your steps and amplify the resonant clatter of metal beneath you, creating a sharp, ringing clang that reverberates through the environment. The disruptive noise causes nearby creatures to lose focus and become disoriented.- Creatures within a 15- foot radius of the source must make a Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 sound damage and have disadvantage on Perception checks for the next minute as they struggle to recover from the ringing.- The sound effects can be heard clearly through solid objects, and creatures within range must make a second saving throw if they are engaged in any concentration spells or abilities. On a failure, their concentration is broken.

You slam your feet against the metal grating, and the amplified clang reverberates across the battlefield. The sound is so intense it rattles the bones of your enemies, disorienting their senses and clouding their judgment. The metallic hum lingers in the air as they struggle to regain their composure.

spell.name: Reverb Cloak
entries: You attune your presence to the resonating echoes of the surrounding environment, causing your form to distort and flicker like a ripple in sound. In places with reflective or hollow surfaces, such as concrete tunnels or other echoing terrains, your form becomes harder to focus on, creating confusion and uncertainty.- The first attack against you each round has disadvantage, as your form fluctuates within the echoes, making it difficult for enemies to track your exact location.- While the spell lasts, you gain advantage on Stealth checks to hide in areas with echoing acoustics, such as tunnels, caves, or large, noisy chambers.

The sound around you warps, bending and distorting with each subtle movement. The rhythmic pulse of your steps creates ripples in the air, making it difficult for enemies to pinpoint you amidst the shifting echoes of the walls. In the oppressive silence of the concrete tunnels, your presence is felt, but never fully seen, and your enemies are left chasing after fleeting sounds, unaware of your true location.

spell.name: Rhythmic Movement
entries: The natural flow of the parquet wood beneath you guides your movements as you flicker momentarily between positions, destabilizing your form and reappearing in a more advantageous stance.- You gain advantage on your next Dexterity (Acrobatics) check or melee attack roll made before the end of your next turn.- If you are within 5 feet of a surface or object (like a wall or ledge), you can use your bonus action to teleport up to 10 feet in any direction within range. This teleportation does not provoke opportunity attacks.

As you channel the natural flow of the parquet wood underfoot, you feel your body sync with the rhythm of the world around you. With a sudden flicker, your position changes, leaving only a brief blur behind before you land in a new, more favorable spot. The pulse of the earth beneath you supports your every movement, creating a seamless blend of natural agility and supernatural grace.

spell.name: Runes of Inconsequence
entries:
You inscribe a rune onto a piece of paper, document, or surface. The rune hums with unstable magical nonsense, waiting for the next creature to read or open the marked object. When triggered, the rune unleashes a harmless but dramatic effect that startles, annoys, or mildly entertains.

The effect is randomly determined by rolling a d6:

The rune fades after being triggered. A creature that succeeds a DC 13 Arcana check while inspecting the document can spot the rune before triggering it.

d6 | Harmless Effect
--- |---------------- 
1 | A burst of confetti and a trumpet fanfare plays.
2 | The reader hears a magical raspberry blown directly into their ear.
3 | A tiny banner pops out: “Gotcha!”
4 | The paper insults the reader in a refined accent.
5 | Glitter explodes everywhere. It sticks.
6 | A small illusory bird flaps out and poops ghost ink on them.

spell.name: Sanguine Ink
entries: You conjure a thin line of crimson ink, written in your own blood, onto a surface within reach. The writing is in a language you know and can be as fine or elaborate as desired. You can erase the writing at will, but others cannot remove it by mundane means. The ink dries immediately and cannot be smudged. If used on a creature’s skin, it fades naturally in 24 hours.

spell.name: Scorned Mark
entries:
You inscribe an invisible sigil onto a creature or surface—an anomalous imprint that flickers just outside visible light. The mark is imperceptible to normal senses but can be perceived by you, and by others under the effects of an attunement protocol (such as *Reveal Transmission*, *Trace Anomaly*, or *See the Unseen*). 

You may choose one of the following effects for the mark: 
- It emits a subtle warmth or chill to those who touch it. 
- It causes a sense of unease or dread when handled. 
- It makes the marked object feel subtly *wrong* to the attuned. 

If placed on a creature, the mark persists until the duration ends or the target takes chiaric damage (1 HP or more). The sigil has no impact on gameplay unless revealed, but its presence may trigger paranormal sensors, bureaucratic alarms, or ritual interactions.
A.S.T.R.A.L. monitoring stations can flag this anomaly for review if detected.

spell.name: Seduce Hollows
entries:
A binding ritual forces one or more undead entities into total compliance with the caster’s physical or emotional desires.

- The undead must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, they cannot resist the caster’s commands for the duration.
- If forced into pleasurable acts, they take 1d6 chiaric damage per instance of forced compliance.
- This spell is illegal under A.S.T.R.A.L. anomaly regulations and has severe ethical consequences.

spell.name: Severed Whisper
entries: You invoke the name of something lost to time, letting its voice slip through your own. A creature of your choice within range hears a whisper from the void. It must make a Wisdom saving throw or become momentarily overwhelmed, causing it to miss the next verbal component it attempts to use before the start of your next turn. If the target does not cast spells, it instead hesitates, reducing its speed by 10 feet for one round.

spell.name: Shadow of an Elevator
entries: You subtly confuse the layout of a building. While active, any creature unfamiliar with the location might experience a brief moment of directional uncertainty—walking to an office they’ve used for years only to find a storage closet, or stepping onto an elevator that momentarily appears to be missing a button. The effect does not create actual spatial distortions but causes minor lapses in familiarity.

spell.name: Shatter Step
entries: You focus a controlled vibration into the glass floor beneath you, causing a sudden concussive burst that shatters the surface. The shockwave ripples outward, damaging those within range.- Adjacent creatures (within 5 feet) must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 1d6 sonic damage and are deafened until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not deafened.- You suffer no ill effects from the glass beneath you, and you remain unharmed.

The druid channels the earth’s natural vibrations through the glass floor, using it as a conduit for explosive energy. The floor shatters like glass under the force of a wave, sending concussive shockwaves into any creature unlucky enough to be nearby. The spell’s precise vibration control makes it an effective tool for both damaging enemies and disrupting their balance, while the unique use of sound as a weapon provides an eerie, almost supernatural quality to the druid’s powers.

spell.name: Shifting Hallway
entries: You subtly alter the perception of an indoor corridor or room, causing it to appear slightly longer, shorter, or misaligned. A creature attempting to navigate the affected area must make an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC or briefly hesitate, treating the terrain as difficult for one round.

spell.name: Sibilant Murmurs
entries: You whisper a fleeting phrase laced with unsettling intent, audible only to one creature within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or hear your voice echoing around them, causing mild disorientation. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on its next attack roll or ability check before the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Silhouette Link
entries: A nearly invisible strand of shadow stretches between you and a creature within range. For the duration, you always know the direction of the target as long as they remain within range. The thread vanishes if the target moves behind total cover or crosses a body of water wider than 5 feet.

spell.name: Slick Shift
entries:
You move with the fluid grace of linoleum, your steps slick and effortless. Your body adapts to the environment, allowing you to glide over the floor, avoiding interference from foes.- You can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on this turn.- You cannot provoke opportunity attacks from creatures during this round.

While under the effects of Slick Shift, your movement feels smooth, and you can maneuver without interruption, easily slipping past those who would otherwise hinder your progress.

A druid whose connection to nature extends even to the man- made, finds that smooth, slippery surfaces enhance their innate agility. They become one with the fluidity of their environment, gracefully dodging and flowing with the world around them. The smoothness of linoleum beneath their feet, while mundane to others, is an avenue for their effortless escape from danger, as they shift with the ease of water slipping through their fingers.

spell.name: Slitherword
entries:
You speak with a voice that does not belong to you—layered, shifting, and wrong.
 
One creature of your choice within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save:
- The creature flinches involuntarily, disrupting its focus.
- If it takes an action on its next turn, it must spend its bonus action first, if available.
- If it has no bonus action to use, its speed is reduced by 10 feet instead.

 A creature that succeeds on its saving throw is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

spell.name: Solid Footing
entries:
You draw strength from the stability of concrete beneath your feet, solidifying your posture and ensuring that you cannot be easily moved. Your connection to the earth gives you exceptional resistance to being pushed or knocked down.

You gain advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made to resist knockback or any effects that would push, pull, or topple you. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

A druid attuned to the urban landscape or the resilience of built environments uses concrete’s unyielding nature to channel an innate stability. They sense the deep foundation of the ground beneath them, drawing on its permanence to stand firm against any attempt to disrupt their position. The caster’s posture straightens as if they themselves have become part of the unmovable structure around them, ready to resist whatever forces attempt to unseat them.

spell.name: Soothing Pulse
entries:
The soothing comfort of velvet carpet emanates from your being, gently reinforcing your body and spirit. The calming energy wraps around you, providing minor restorative benefits and a sense of calm resilience.

You gain 1d4 temporary hit points, which last until you take a short or long rest. This temporary hit points cannot stack and are replenished with each casting of the spell.

A druid who has learned to embrace the comfort of natural softness manifests a calming aura as they attune to the environment around them. The soothing nature of soft, plush materials like velvet becomes a channel for their connection to comfort, warmth, and rejuvenation. As they breathe in deeply, the tension in their body releases, replaced by a quiet, resilient strength, echoing the peaceful tranquility of the soft carpet beneath their feet.

spell.name: Splinter Dart
entries:
Drawing upon the natural flow of the wooden environment around you, you call forth a sharpened splinter from the very floor or nearby wooden structures, launching it with precision and agility.

You make a ranged spell attack against one creature within 20 feet. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 tearing damage as a splinter of wood embeds itself in their body.

Urban druids who specialize in interior architecture and sustainable urban environments often rely on wooden elements to channel their magic. When they cast this spell, small creaks and pulses of energy resonate through the wooden beams, and the floor beneath them seems to bend slightly before a sudden burst of sharp wooden projectiles is released.

spell.name: Splintered Reflection
entries: Your form fractures for a brief moment, as though seen through a cracked mirror. Until the start of your next turn, you can choose to roll a d4 and subtract the result from the first melee or ranged attack roll made against you. The attacker sees multiple afterimages of you shifting slightly out of sync.

spell.name: Static Discharge
entries:
Harnessing the ambient static energy in the surroundings, you gather a charge from the office carpet, the fibers crackling with electric potential. With a sudden release, you unleash a crackling arc of lightning toward a target.

Make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target takes 1d6 electric damage. If the target is wearing metal armor or has metal equipment, the damage increases by 1, making the strike particularly painful.

In modern environments, especially in offices or warehouses, druids attuned to urban ecosystems often make use of mundane, overlooked energy sources like the static charge from carpets, furniture, and other everyday objects. The caster feels the tiny crackles of static energy building around them, their hand briefly glowing with arcane power before they release the lightning- like spark at their target, often surprising the unprepared.

spell.name: Static Field
entries:
By reaching toward an exposed maintenance grate or metallic conduit, you unleash a sharp surge of static electricity, discharging the built- up current into nearby enemies.

Choose one creature within 10 feet of you that is standing on or adjacent to metal flooring, a grate, conduit, or similar surface. That creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 electric damage and lose its reaction until the start of its next turn.

Urban druids and infrastructure witches have long known how to manipulate the invisible flows of static that build beneath cities. A quick gesture, a whispered word, and the ambient hum becomes a stinging pulse. It doesn’t stop hearts—but it might stop someone from drawing steel.

The faint smell of ozone and dust lingers in the air after the spell discharges.

spell.name: Static Veil
entries: A faint hum distorts reality around you. Until the start of your next turn, any attempt to record or broadcast your presence via analog or digital devices produces static, blurred imagery, or flickering distortions. This does not prevent direct observation, but any recorded footage will appear corrupted or unusable.

spell.name: Stillness of the Grave
entries: You slow your breathing and still your pulse, imitating the lifeless calm of a corpse. Until the spell ends, you appear dead to mundane inspection, such as touch or sight. A creature that physically examines you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check to determine that you are still alive. This effect does not suppress your ability to move or speak, but any voluntary action ends the spell immediately.

spell.name: Surefooted Leap
entries:
You attune your balance and momentum to the structural rhythm of your surroundings—metal beams, concrete ledges, scaffolding, and rooftop catwalks. For the briefest moment, the world feels designed for your movement.

Until the start of your next turn, your long jump distance is doubled, and you do not need a 10- foot run- up to make a long jump.

This movement ignores difficult terrain caused by uneven platforms, narrow ledges, or slippery surfaces, as long as they are part of a constructed or elevated structure (e.g., catwalks, fire escapes, scaffolding, or city rooftop obstacles).

Surefooted Leap is commonly used by urban druids, parkour enthusiasts, and rooftop messengers trained by nature itself. They move not like people, but like whispers on the wind—navigating a city’s skeleton with the grace of a climbing vine or the leap of a fox from rusted girder to bent pipe.

When this spell is cast, there’s a moment where gravity seems to wait—just long enough for you to leap farther than you should.

spell.name: Tile Pulse
entries:
You attune yourself to the fractured lifeblood of the city—cracks in pavement, broken tiles, and splintered stone—awakening the pulse beneath the ground.

You stomp or strike the ground, and a violent pulse of force erupts outward from a fractured surface within range. The magic seeks instability, targeting seams and breaks to launch razor- sharp shards in all directions.

Choose a point on the ground within 30 feet that contains fractured terrain (e.g., cracked concrete, shattered tile, weathered brick). All creatures within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 impact damage as they are struck by magically propelled debris. On a success, they take no damage.

spell.name: Tremor Sign
entries: You tap the ground, sending a ripple of energy through the surface. A creature standing on solid ground within range must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or momentarily lose balance, forcing it to make its next attack roll or Dexterity check with disadvantage. If the terrain is loose or unstable, the effect is automatically successful.

spell.name: Tweak/Goose
entries:
A pulse of low- frequency nerve stimulation targets a muscle group or sensitive area, triggering a sharp jolt of sensation akin to a goosebump- inducing touch.

- The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or experience an involuntary twitch, shiver, or sharp intake of breath, losing their next reaction.

This spell is often misused in underground establishments, enhancing paid experiences or delivering unexpected sensations.

spell.name: Veilborn Glimmer
entries: Your body shimmers with ethereal light, briefly phasing between reality and the unknown. For the duration, you can dim or brighten your own appearance at will, causing yourself to glow faintly (shedding dim light in a 5- foot radius) or become shadowed (light sources within 10 feet of you appear dimmer). This effect ends if you fall unconscious or dismiss it as a bonus action.

spell.name: Verdant Renewal
entries:
You touch a patch of resilient green—be it moss growing through cracked pavement or ivy clinging to concrete—and draw strength from its quiet persistence.

Upon casting this spell, a subtle green glow briefly pulses around your feet and chest. For the next minute:- You gain resistance to poison damage.- You have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to resist or recover from exhaustion.

This effect represents the restorative essence of hardy flora—clinging life that thrives in adversity, even in forgotten corners of the city.

Verdant Renewal is a hallmark 0- Cantrip of druids who walk the forgotten arteries of modern sprawl—those who find nature not in forests, but in the weeds in gutters, moss in subways, and roots beneath asphalt. These druids believe resilience is nature’s truest gift—and draw upon it to steady their own breath in moments of fatigue and illness.

spell.name: Wardrobe Malfunction
entries:
You remotely manipulate the fastenings of a creature’s outfit—zippers slip, laces untie, clasps flick open or shut, or corsets snap with whispered precision.
- You may don or doff any simple clothing as a bonus action, including on a willing creature within range.
- If cast on an unwilling creature, they must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have part of their clothing shift, loosen, or fall apart (purely cosmetic, unless specified).
- Subtle castings require a Wisdom (Insight) check against your spell save DC to notice the alteration.

At Higher Tiers:
- If the caster is level 5 or higher, the spell can affect light armor.
- At level 10, it can affect medium or heavy armor, but doing so requires a Strength (Athletics) check (DC 15) to undo or resecure the armor manually.

Druids of the Concrete Vein speak of the city’s pulse as if it were a living thing. Where others see decay, they find breath. Vital Pulse is their heartbeat—an echo of nature breaking through the scars of civilization.

spell.name: Wisp of the Forgotten
entries: You conjure a faint, ghostly whisper from beyond the veil, carrying an unintelligible but haunting message to a creature within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become unnerved until the start of its next turn, giving it disadvantage on the next Wisdom (Perception) check or initiative roll it makes. If the creature is already frightened, it takes cognitive damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

spell.name: Bogbolt
entries:
You conjure and fling a dense glob of swamp muck at a creature within range. The bolt arcs with a disgusting squelch, trailing algae, peat, and mystery goo.

Make a ranged spell attack against a creature. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 impact damage and must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be coated in stinking mire for 1 minute.

While affected:- The target has disadvantage on Charisma checks involving persuasion, performance, or decorum.- The effect ends early if the creature spends an action to scrape or wash off the muck.
This spell is often used less for harm and more for humiliation. The smell lingers longer than the magic.

spell.name: Bonechant Bloom
entries:
You accelerate the growth of parasitic flora hidden in the bones of the land.
- Choose a point on the ground within 30 ft. A twisting vine- bloom erupts in a 10 ft radius.
- Enemies that enter or start their turn there must succeed a Strength save or be restrained until the end of their next turn.
- The vines writhe as if remembering something.

spell.name: Bullet Trace
entries: When you hit a creature with a ranged firearm attack, you mark the target with an invisible tracer. While marked, you always know the exact location of the target within 500 feet and ignore half- cover penalties when attacking the marked creature.

spell.name: Civic Transit
entries: You phase into an invisible transit line used by forgotten city workers. Instantly, you appear at any known bus stop, train station, or parking garage within range.

spell.name: Coitus Compulsum
entries:
You overwhelm a creature with powerful urges of lust and romance. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become compelled by you for the duration, deeply distracted by intimate thoughts and feelings.

Roll 1d6 immediately upon casting to determine a specific additional effect:

Roleplay Potential:
- This spell can cause considerable confusion and social chaos in delicate or diplomatic settings.
- Cultures sensitive to romantic propriety might ban or heavily regulate its use.

| d6 | Random Effect (Love or Lust?) |
|---- |--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1 | The target falls hopelessly in love with the nearest inanimate object, becoming protective and affectionate toward it. |
| 2 | The target becomes incredibly awkward for 1 hour, imposing disadvantage on all Charisma checks and saves. |
| 3 | The target is overcome by romantic impulse and spontaneously proposes marriage to you. |
| 4 | The target gains a +2 bonus to AC due to heightened adrenaline but is unable to attack any creature they find attractive. |
| 5 | The target takes 1d4 psychic damage from embarrassment as they recall every humiliating moment of their romantic past. |
| 6 | A whimsical Cupid- like being appears, openly judging and criticizing the target’s romantic choices for 1 minute. |

An incomplete footnote in a partially corrupted A.S.T.R.A.L. record vaguely describes a “linguistic corruption phenomenon” causing test subjects to irreversibly blur intimacy, enchantment, and compulsion. The rest of the archive is suspiciously absent.

spell.name: Data Leecher
entries:
You drain corrupted memory from a machine or creature. Choose one electronic device or creature:
- On a failed Intelligence save, the target loses access to one memory, password, or protocol (chosen by the GM), and you learn it instead.
- Creatures take 1d8 cognitive damage on failure.

spell.name: Data Scramble
entries: Touching a digital device, you cause its stored data to become incomprehensible, garbled, or distorted. Any attempt to retrieve or access the data requires an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the data remains unreadable for the duration.
Using this spell on government or corporate systems may trigger counter- security measures.

spell.name: Detect Broadcasts
entries: You convert arcane energy into an analog signal, allowing you to transmit a spoken message or magical effect through radio waves, telegraph lines, or wired technology. Spells like *Ciphered Message* and *Ghost Broadcast* can be cast across vast distances if a signal relay exists.

| Encryption Level | BDR |
 |------------------------ |------ |
 | Basic encryption | 10 |
 | Corporate- grade | 15 |
 | Military- grade | 18 |
 | Eldritch interference | 22 |

spell.name: Drain Cognition
entries: You extract fragments of knowledge from the target’s mind. They must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, their spell save DC and Intelligence- based ability checks are reduced by 1d4 for the duration.

spell.name: Emergency Resuscitation Protocol
entries: You stabilize a dying creature and restore 1d4 + your spellcasting modifier hit points. If the target was unconscious, they wake up disoriented and suffer disadvantage on all rolls for 1 round.

spell.name: Encrypted Command
entries:
You speak a single- word command, encoded in an arcane cipher that only the intended target can comprehend. To all other creatures, the word sounds like distorted static, arcane distortion, or nonsensical muttering. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on their next turn, as if affected by the Command spell.

If the target succeeds on their saving throw, they immediately sense that an attempt was made to magically influence their will, though they do not inherently know who cast the spell.

Observers may recognize that a spell was cast but cannot understand the word. A creature within 30 feet who hears the utterance can attempt a DC 13 Arcana or Insight check to discern the nature of the magic, but not the command itself.

spell.name: Eternal Memo
entries: You inscribe a message, signature, or contract onto a non- living object, embedding it permanently into reality. It cannot be erased, burned, or defaced except by a reality altering spell or anomaly.

spell.name: Fingerbang
entries:
You snap your hand into a confident finger gun and unleash a crackling projectile of arcane force shaped like a bullet. Choose one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target.

- On a hit, the target takes 2d6 ballistic damage.
- The projectile leaves behind a faint trail of cigarette smoke and the smell of ozone.
- If cast while wearing sunglasses or leaning on something cool, you may deal an additional +1 damage (DM discretion, style points encouraged).

“Bang.” 
—Last words of Agent V before exiting the parking garage standoff.

spell.name: Flickering Howl
entries:
You mimic the warped cry of something not quite animal, shaking your enemies. All creatures in a 10 ft radius make a Wisdom saving throw.
- On a failure: they are Frightened until the end of their next turn.
- Hollows, Mechanicals, Digitals and Structures have disadvantage on the save.

spell.name: Giocrin's Nostalgia
entries:
You conjure a strange arcane light tied to memory, place, and presence. When casting, choose one of the following:
- Beacon: A soft, haunting light forms at your feet or a space within reach, shedding bright light in a 20- foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The beacon remains stationary for 30 minutes, unaffected by wind or water.
- Flare: You launch a sudden pulse of colored light straight upward, visible for miles if outdoors. The flare lasts 1 round, providing bright light in a 60- foot radius around its apex before fading instantly.

The light can be any color you choose, and is eerie but not blinding—it does not impair vision or deal damage.

Giocrin wandered into forgotten places with a lantern that burned brighter in regret than in darkness. When he vanished, only the flame remained—flickering in places he might have walked, but never did.

The last known caster, Darsil Veil, was found dead beside his burned- out focus. His eyes were empty. His notes described “the whispering ones” and warned: “Some light doesn’t show where we are—it shows what we’ve lost.”

Some believe this spell doesn’t just illuminate—it invites observation from elsewhere.

spell.name: Glossolalia Error
entries: A burst of anomalous interference disrupts speech and incantations. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or be silenced until the end of their next turn. If they were casting a spell, they must make a Concentration check or the spell fails.

spell.name: Gourds and Wharfs
entries:
You summon a whimsical assortment of decorative gourds accompanied by a miniature wooden dock at a point within range. The purpose of this spell is unclear, lost to time, yet oddly charming.

Roll a d6 to determine the precise effect:

| d6 | Summon Result |
|---- |------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1 | A harmless pile of decorative gourds appears. |
| 2 | Gourds appear and burst into harmless, colorful sparks. |
