item.name: Blood Kit (Collection)
entries: Contains vials, needles, and color tags. Used in anomaly blood indexing.

item.name: Bo Staff
entries: 1d8 bludgeoning, two-handed, reach. Sometimes disguised as a mop handle or walking stick.

item.name: Body Harness (Leather)
entries: Intimidating or empowering. Used in some resistance factions as uniform. Can be worn under tactical gear.

item.name: Bomb Squad Vest
entries: Extremely bulky. Grants resistance to fire and force damage, but gives disadvantage on DEX saves. Requires STR 15.

item.name: Bondage Kit (Starter)
entries: Includes cuffs (padded or metal), blindfold, rope, and guidebook. Found beneath shelves. Often re-sold.

item.name: Book of Matches (Local Diner)
entries: Paper pack with 8 matches. Half are already torn. One match is thicker than the others.

item.name: Boom Box
entries: Massive, with dual cassette decks and a radio tuner. Sometimes carried as a status symbol.

item.name: Box Cutter
entries: A retractable utility blade, commonly found in warehouses. Sharp, quick, and underestimated.

item.name: Brass Knuckles
entries: Concealable. 1d4 bludgeoning, adds punch damage. Counts as an unarmed strike enhancer.

item.name: Breach Pellet (Directional)
entries: Focused directional charge for door or wall breaching. Won’t harm targets outside blast vector.

item.name: Brick Charge (ANFO)
entries: Ammonium nitrate–based. Less stable, heavy, and highly destructive. Found in construction and mining circles.

item.name: Brick of TNT (Military)
entries: Stable and heavy. Set with timed fuse. Often found in decommissioned A.S.T.R.A.L. black sites.

item.name: Broadcast Kit
entries: Radios, tape recorders, signal repeaters, VHS decks. (Broadcast hidden messages, intercept communications, feed into anomalies.)

item.name: Broken Sword
entries: A damaged blade with jagged edges. Feels wrong in your hand but still cuts.

item.name: Bulletproof Vest (Level I)
entries: Resists most small arms. Grants disadvantage on Stealth due to rigidity.

item.name: Bulletproof Vest (Level II)
entries: Resists most small arms. Grants disadvantage on Stealth due to rigidity.

item.name: Bulletproof Vest (Level III)
entries: Resists most small arms. Grants disadvantage on Stealth due to rigidity.

item.name: Butcher Knife
entries: A heavy kitchen knife used for cleaving meat. Often stained and well-worn.

item.name: Butterfly Knives
entries: 1d4 slashing, concealable, finesse. Illegal in most districts; favored by flashy street duelists.

item.name: C4 Charge (Block)
entries: Plastic explosive designed for precise breaching or demolition. Must be detonated via remote or timed device. Leaves clean, controlled craters.

item.name: Cable Restraints
entries: Electric zip cuffs. Target must succeed a DC 13 STR check to break free.

item.name: Camera Flashbulb (Loose)
entries: Can be manually triggered as a distraction or to blind something sensitive to light.

item.name: Camera Kit (Analog)
entries: Polaroid, film rolls, UV film, night lenses. (Capture evidence, blind spirits, activate exposure-based rituals.)

item.name: Canteen
entries: Metal container with oil-like residue. Water stays cold—or turns black if left near an anomaly too long.

item.name: Card Catalog Cabinet
entries: Found in libraries or archive centers. Cards are often misfiled or missing… deliberately.

item.name: Cassette Player
entries: A portable music player, often with cheap earbuds and worn-out buttons. Some are rigged to reverse audio.

item.name: Ceremonial Bodyplate (Cultist)
entries: Nonstandard alloy. Slightly unsettling to look at. May attract paranormal attention when damaged.

item.name: Ceremonial Saber
entries: 1d6 slashing, often nonfunctional but still sharp.

item.name: Chain Whip
entries: 1d6 slashing, reach, finesse. Banned in security zones. Can grapple or trip.

item.name: Chains (Looped or Loose)
entries: Reach 10 ft. Grapples or restrains on hit. 1d4 bludgeoning.

item.name: Chalkboard
entries: Still in use. Coated in layers of faint writing and dust. Sometimes messages appear when no one’s around.

item.name: Chemistry Set
entries: Smells like high school and horror — reagents, test tubes, burners, swabs. (Detect substances, brew toxins, analyze blood/smoke.)

item.name: Chest Binder / Shapewear
entries: Sold quietly from behind the counter. Includes size warnings, self-written disclaimers, and a faded “no refunds” tag.

item.name: Cigarette Case (Empty)
entries: Always empty when opened—no matter how much you remember putting something inside. Stylish, dented. Some have mirror-polish interiors or old love notes tucked behind the liner.

item.name: Cigarette Pack (Unopened)
entries: Standard stress relief item. Also used as payment, distraction, or even a hidden stash.

item.name: Claymore Mine
entries: Fires in a cone. 4d10 piercing in a 60° arc, 15 ft. range. Often used in ambushes or perimeter traps.

item.name: Cleaver
entries: A square, weighty blade from a butcher’s block. Has a satisfying heft.

item.name: Cleaver (Butcher’s)
entries: 1d6 slashing, evokes horror-movie energy.

item.name: Climb Gear (Harness + Hooks)
entries: Full-body analog climbing rig. Loud, slow, reliable. Required for scaling structures or abandoned corporate vaults.

item.name: Clipboard (Metal)
entries: Used for security checklists or outdated inventory logs. Often stained or dented.

item.name: Clipboard (Steel-Backed)
entries: Reinforced to serve as a writing surface or makeshift bludgeon. Common among field agents.

item.name: Cluster Charge
entries: Breaks into smaller charges mid-air. Each deals 3d6 in separate 5 ft. radius bursts. Great for room-clearing.

item.name: Cock Ring (Metal)
entries: Some engraved. Some magnetic. One vibrates if you get within 20 ft. of a containment anomaly. (???)

item.name: Cold Pack (Snap-to-Activate)
entries: Used to treat blunt trauma or nerve shock. Field-tested and chemically activated.

item.name: Combat Gi (Reinforced)
entries: Martial-arts uniform adapted with padding and joint plates. Worn by underground fighters or rogue agents.

item.name: Combat Shield (Polymer/Steel)
entries: Grants +2 AC, may bash for 1d4 bludgeoning. Branded with corporate logos.

item.name: 9×19mm Parabellum
entries: The most common handgun and SMG cartridge in modern use. Reliable, versatile, and widely manufactured across civilian and military sectors.

item.name: 9mm
entries: A generic shorthand for the 9×19mm Parabellum or similar cartridges. Often used interchangeably with standard service pistol ammo.

item.name: .44 Magnum
entries: A powerful revolver cartridge favored for its massive stopping power. Known for heavy recoil and devastating close-range damage.

item.name: .50 Action Express
entries: An extremely high-caliber pistol round used in hand cannons. Capable of penetrating armored targets at short range with explosive impact.

item.name: Concussive Charge
entries: 3d10 thunder damage, knocks targets prone. Designed for clearing rooms without structural damage.

item.name: Concussive Hammer
entries: 1d10 thunder. Emits a shockwave on hit. May knock target prone on failed STR save. Weight requires STR 15+.

item.name: Condoms (Box)
entries: Latex or synthetic. Found in outdated packaging. Some are expired. Others have questionable branding like “Executive Edition.”

item.name: Containment Kit
entries: Silver tape, labeled jars, reinforced box, lead shielding, biohazard bags. (Used to contain samples, cursed objects, or mobile anomalies.)

item.name: Containment Lasso (Wired)
entries: Used by containment agents. Grapples or restrains; can administer electric shock.

item.name: Corporate Powered Harness
entries: Battery-powered exoskeleton assists lifting and impact deflection. Requires charging. STR 16 required.

item.name: Corporate Roast (Bag)
entries: A.S.T.R.A.L.-approved beans. Sealed in a white plastic pouch labeled “Productivity Blend – Level II”.

item.name: Corpse Tag Set
entries: Toe tags, wristbands, and a form labeled “BODY RECEIVED: UNCLAIMED.”

item.name: Crowbar
entries: Doubles as leverage tool or pry bar. 1d6 bludgeoning, advantage on prying objects.

item.name: Crowd Control Umbrella
entries: Opens wide, reinforced tips. Used to block line of sight or redirect fog/anomalies.

item.name: CRT Head-Mounted Display
entries: Obsolete HUD linked to sensors (vital signs, location). Analog screen, flickers often. Requires bulky battery pack.

item.name: CRT Television
entries: A chunky screen with dials and wood paneling. Turns on slowly, with a flicker of static.

item.name: Cryo-Response Suit
entries: Insulated for extreme cold. Grants resistance to cold damage and slows bleeding. Battery lasts 30 min.

item.name: Cup Noodle Kettle Combo
entries: Combination of cup-holder and induction plate. Doubles as a trap if reverse-wired.

item.name: Net Gun Cartridge
entries: A compressed gas-powered cartridge that deploys a weighted net to entangle and immobilize targets. Often used for capture or crowd control.

item.name: Decon Team Armor
entries: Hybrid of riot armor and chem suit. Can wade into viral anomalies. Grants immunity to contagion spells or paranormal mold.

item.name: Desk Organizer
entries: Solid and cold to the touch. Holds pens, notepads, and the occasional keycard.

item.name: Desktop Intercom
entries: Used in corporate buildings. Cracks with static when left unattended too long.

item.name: Dice (Casino-Weighted)
entries: One side always rolls 6—or never does. Found in coat pockets or body bags.

item.name: Disposable Camera
entries: Click-and-wind operation. Film needs to be developed. One in ten photos reveals something strange.

item.name: Disposable Gloves (Latex)
entries: Essential for evidence handling. Often too tight or already powdered.

item.name: Phantom Clip
entries: A smart magazine loaded with encrypted sub-sonic caseless rounds. Also carries targeting telemetry for smartguns with onboard systems.

item.name: Disposable Vibrator
entries: Battery-powered, one-time use. Can be turned on and rolled into distracting places. Louder than it should be.

item.name: Dot Matrix Printer
entries: Loud, grinding machine that prints in faded ink. Often used for ID badges or corporate logs.

item.name: Plasma Core
entries: A high-density fuel cell suspended in magnetic containment. Powers plasma-based rifles with destructive energy bursts and superheated gas.

item.name: 7.62×51mm NATO
entries: A full-power rifle cartridge used in designated marksman rifles and machine guns. Renowned for long-range precision and reliability.

item.name: 5.56×45mm NATO
entries: A standard intermediate rifle cartridge used in assault rifles. Offers good balance of range, recoil, and armor-piercing potential.

item.name: .300 Winchester Magnum
entries: A high-powered sniper cartridge with exceptional ballistic performance. Used for precision shooting over extended distances.

item.name: .30-30 Winchester
entries: A classic lever-action rifle round. Known for moderate recoil and effectiveness against medium-sized targets at short-to-mid range.

item.name: Duct Tape
entries: The gray fix-all. Can seal doors, bind suspects, or silence anomalies. Everyone carries a roll.

item.name: Dust Mask (Cloth)
entries: Meant for factory workers. Reduces inhalation of toxic spores or paranormal particulates.

item.name: Eclipsing Sight
entries: See through walls/illusions; prolonged use may cause paranoia.

item.name: Electric Chai
entries: Spiced, sweet, and served piping hot in metal flasks. Contains mild stimulant properties.

item.name: Electronic Repair Kit
entries: Used to rewire, fix, or disable analog electronics. Includes soldering iron, wire stripper, and multimeter. (Bypasses cameras, fixes circuits, sabotages implants.)

item.name: Electroprod
entries: 1d4 lightning, used in riot suppression or anomaly wrangling. Limited charges.

item.name: EMP Charge
entries: Knocks out electronics in a 20 ft. radius. Disables cameras, drones, and containment tech. Doesn’t harm living targets.

item.name: Employee Handbook (Redacted)
entries: Corporate manual. Most pages are blacked out. Page 13 is missing completely.

item.name: Enamel Pin (Corporate Division)
entries: Each pin reflects a department. Some grant small bonuses to NPC reactions when displayed.

item.name: Rubber Bullet Magazine
entries: A detachable magazine loaded with rubber or plastic bullets for riot control. Non-lethal but capable of serious injury at close range.

item.name: 12 Gauge Slug
entries: A single heavy metal projectile fired from a shotgun. Excellent for short-range armor penetration and door breaching.

item.name: 12 Gauge Buckshot
entries: Contains multiple metal pellets, spreading upon firing. Highly lethal at close range and favored for home defense and tactical use.

item.name: 12 Gauge Short Shells
entries: Compact shotgun shells with reduced recoil and pellet count. Ideal for small shotguns and increased magazine capacity.

item.name: Energy Syrup Shot
entries: 50 ml bottle of electric neon sludge. Tastes like adrenaline and regret. Glows under blacklight.

item.name: Evidence Bag (Labeled)
entries: Clear plastic pouch with chain-of-custody tags. May contain dried residue or unknown hair.

item.name: Fake Mustache Kit
entries: Comes with 6 adhesive options. One smells like shoe polish.

item.name: Faux-Fur Handcuffs
entries: Harmless but lockable. The keys are often lost. Symbolic in certain anomalous rituals.

item.name: Fax Machine
entries: Slow, loud, and prone to paper jams. Messages are sometimes received with no sender.

item.name: Field Agent Armor (Internal)
entries: Custom-fitted armored bodysuit. Grants +2 to CON saves vs. anomalies.

item.name: Field Dissection Tools
entries: Foldable scalpel set. Found in old black-site lockers. Used for “non-standard autopsies.”

item.name: Field Notes (Government-Issued)
entries: Pre-lined, pre-numbered notebooks. Some pages are already filled out, though not by you.

item.name: Field Scanner (Multi-Spectrum)
entries: Switches between UV, EM, and Infrared. Needs to be manually dialed in. Emits a click-whine-click each time. Great for spotting illusion seams.

item.name: Fire Axe
entries: Carried by emergency responders. 1d8 slashing, counts as a tool.

item.name: Fire Poker
entries: Long iron rod. 1d6 piercing/bludgeoning. Often overlooked.

item.name: First Aid Kit (1970s)
entries: Includes iodine, gauze, and morphine ampoules. Heavy but effective.

item.name: Fishnet Bodysuit
entries: Tears easily. Looks amazing under trench coats in the right circles. Questionably flame-resistant.

item.name: Flak Jacket (Old Military)
entries: Outdated and heavy. Reduces critical hits but offers less flexibility.

item.name: 5cc Neuro-Dart
entries: A tranquilizer dart filled with neuro-suppressant chemicals. Designed for silent takedowns of living targets without lasting harm.

item.name: Flash Cartridge (Camera)
entries: Can be used to blind targets in dim light. Forces WIS save or suffer disadvantage on next attack.

item.name: Flash Cubes (Loose)
entries: One-use flashes for old cameras. Can trigger paranormal visibility in dim light.

item.name: Flashbang Grenade
entries: Blinds and deafens creatures in a 20 ft. radius for 1d4 rounds on failed CON save. Used for breaching or crowd control.

item.name: Heavy-Duty Flashlight
entries: A long metal flashlight. Can be used as an improvised weapon. Flickers if shaken.

item.name: Flavored Gel (Small Tube)
entries: Sticky, overly sweet. Comes in suspicious “banana-cream cola” or “corporate cherry.” Rarely enjoyable.

item.name: Flip Clock
entries: Mechanically displays time by flipping plastic number tiles. Makes a loud clack every minute.

item.name: Floppy Disk Drive
entries: Usually found in forgotten IT closets. Occasionally contains mysterious corporate memos.

item.name: Fold-Out Map (Crumpled)
entries: Street-level layout of Concord City, annotated by past operatives. Several safehouses circled, a few crossed out.

item.name: Foldable Umbrella
entries: Could pass as a cane or be repurposed as a stake. Ineffective in real storms.

item.name: Folding Chair (Steel)
entries: Uncomfortable and loud when unfolded. Used in break rooms and waiting areas.

item.name: Folding Magnifier
entries: Pocket-sized with x10 zoom. Used for detail work. Reveals far more than it should under moonlight.

item.name: Folding Pocket Knife
entries: A simple foldable knife carried for utility. Reliable, worn, and always within reach.

item.name: Forensics Kit
entries: Blacklight, fingerprint powder, bone scanner, blood reagent. (Examine remains, identify signs of possession, detect bodily anomalies.)

item.name: Fragmentation Grenade
entries: 4d6 piercing damage in a 15 ft. radius. Standard military surplus, highly restricted.

item.name: Freeze-Dried Coffee (Packet)
entries: Bitter, dusty, dissolves poorly. Preferred by field agents for its punch and shelf life.

item.name: Gag (Ball or Ring)
entries: Typically part of restraint kits. Popular in underground arenas and intimacy cults alike.

item.name: Fuel Tank
entries: A pressurized canister of combustible fluid. Used by flamethrowers and industrial incinerators; dangerous and volatile.

item.name: Graph Paper Pad
entries: Gridded for precision notes, mapping anomalies, or sketching spell effects. Often has coffee stains and corner curls.

item.name: Green Tea (Radiation-Safe)
entries: Brewed to counteract long-term anomaly exposure. A.S.T.R.A.L. recommends two cups daily.

item.name: Gum Pack (Unopened)
entries: Mint-flavored. Can be chewed for calm or stuck to a door sensor. One stick feels warm to the touch.

item.name: Gutter Arc Blade
entries: 1d8 lightning. A machete fused with illegal energy plates. Burns holes through steel and reality. Battery overheats in rain.

item.name: Hammer (Sledge/Claw)
entries: Powerful blow. 1d6–1d10 bludgeoning depending on size.

item.name: 9×18mm Makarov
entries: A slightly lower-pressure cartridge compared to 9mm Parabellum. Common in compact pistols and older military sidearms.

item.name: .38 Hollow-Point Cartridge
entries: A classic revolver round with a concave tip. Expands upon impact to maximize internal damage while reducing overpenetration.

item.name: Hazmat Suit (Basic)
entries: Grants immunity to airborne toxins and chemicals. Disadvantage on Stealth and Athletics. Bulky.

item.name: Heavy Rotary Stamp
entries: Used to mark papers as “APPROVED” or “VOID.” Ink pads often dry or blood-colored.

item.name: Ice Pick
entries: Designed to crack ice—now used to crack skulls. Quiet and efficient.

item.name: Improvised Flamethrower
entries: Made from hairspray and a lighter. Deals 2d6 fire in a 5 ft. cone. One use only.

item.name: Impulse Fist Module
entries: 1d6 thunder, unarmed strike enhancer. Looks like brass knuckles connected to an old modem. Emits static on contact.

item.name: Industrial Desk Lamp
entries: Adjustable arm with exposed springs. Casts a stark cone of light and gets dangerously hot.

item.name: Ink Grenade
entries: Explodes in black ink and dye. Disorients enemies, obscures vision, and marks targets for drones. Often used in protests.

item.name: Ink Pad & Rubber Stamps
entries: Used in low-security bureaucracy zones. Stamps include “Cleared,” “Filed,” and “Do Not Engage.”

item.name: Instant Coffee (Expired)
entries: Smells like paint thinner. Still somehow more popular than newer brands.

item.name: IV Kit (Outdated)
entries: Used in field stabilization. Expired 15 years ago but mostly works.

item.name: Jumpsuit (Maintenance)
entries: Believable disguise for infiltrating secure or industrial zones. Smells faintly of bleach and dust.

item.name: Kali Sticks (Pair)
entries: Two weapons, 1d4 bludgeoning each. Concealable and brutal in trained hands. Used by underground enforcers.

item.name: Key Ring (Massive)
entries: Contains 20+ unlabeled keys. One always seems to open something, eventually.

item.name: Kill-Chain Circuit
entries: Adds stacking +1d6 per hit; backlash if you miss.

item.name: Kitchen Knife
entries: Commonplace. 1d4 piercing, easy to improvise.

item.name: Kitchen Knife
entries: A common cooking knife, sharp and easy to hide. Sometimes used in crimes of passion.

item.name: Latex Gloves
entries: One-size-fits-most. Can be used for medical, forensic, or sensual purposes. Often sold in packs of 6.

item.name: Leather Duster (Treated)
entries: Coated for chemical resistance. Popular with urban survivalists. Half protection, half fashion.

item.name: Letter Opener
entries: A slim blade intended for paper but perfectly capable of piercing flesh.

item.name: LIDAR Scope (Mounted)
entries: Bounces light pulses to map rooms. Emits faint clicking. Can detect movement behind thin walls or glass. Needs tripod or helmet mount.

item.name: Lighter
entries: Engraved with logos from dead corporations. Works every time—or never when it counts.

item.name: Lingerie Set (Mesh/Lace)
entries: Cheap, synthetic. Worn for seduction, confidence, or as club disguises. Often includes fishnets and detachable clips.

item.name: Lock Override Tools
entries: Not quite lockpicks — more like badge spoofers, magnetic pulse cards, and torque jigs. (Open doors, disable analog safes, force security shutters.)

item.name: Lockpick Set (Basic)
entries: Fold-out set of tools hidden in a cigarette case. Used by janitors, thieves, and agents.

item.name: Loose Cigarette (Unlit)
entries: Often passed around. Used in deals, favors, or as offerings to the dead.

item.name: Lottery Ticket (Scratched)
entries: A losing ticket… maybe. Sometimes the numbers rearrange at night.

item.name: Lubricant (Tube)
entries: Water- or silicone-based. Useful not only for intimacy, but also lockpicking, escape attempts, or ghost-slick rituals.

item.name: Machete
entries: A long, curved blade designed for cutting brush—repurposed for defense or violence.

item.name: Mag-Lev Baton
entries: 1d6 bludgeoning + 1d4 force. Repulsion pulses on contact. Sometimes recoils in the user’s hand.

item.name: Magnifying Glass
entries: Thick-lensed and brass-framed. Warps reflections. Some say it sees more than it should.

item.name: Manila Folders
entries: Frayed at the edges. Often marked with color-coded labels or old coffee stains.

item.name: Manual Typewriter
entries: A heavy metal machine. Still used in isolated or “low-interference” departments.

item.name: Matchbook (Soggy Corner)
entries: From “Club Retrograde” or “The Hollow Stage Lounge.” 6 matches remain. Backside contains a phone number.

item.name: Measuring Tape (Retractable)
entries: Used for containment geometry or calculating ritual circles. Sometimes retracts on its own.

item.name: Mechanic’s Kit
entries: Includes a ratchet set, tape, crowbar, and a user manual from 1972. (Fix doors, dismantle panels, reinforce barricades, make improvised weapons.)

item.name: Metal Lunchbox (Worn)
entries: Dented and stained, but sturdy. Holds food, files, or contraband. Often marked with faded cartoon decals.

item.name: Microfilm Reader
entries: A clunky, dusty machine found in archives and corporate libraries. Can zoom into anything—sometimes too far.

item.name: Misfire Codex
entries: has +2 to attacks/damage; 10% chance to misfire on random target.

item.name: Molotov Cocktail
entries: 2d6 fire in 5 ft. radius. Ignites flammable objects. Made from bottles and fuel. Illegal but common.

item.name: Monofilament Whip
entries: 1d6 slashing, finesse, reach. Nearly invisible strand of wire on a weighted handle. Cuts through fabric like air.

item.name: Mug Warmer (Desk Plate)
entries: A sad, low-watt heating disk plugged into a frayed wall socket. Smells like ozone.

item.name: Multi-Tool (Analog)
entries: Includes a screwdriver, blade, can opener, and pliers. Mechanically clunky but reliable.

item.name: Mystic Blend Tea (Loose Leaf)
entries: Faintly floral with hints of copper. Brewed by the Dawnkeepers. May grant mild clarity or headaches.

item.name: Nail File (Metal)
entries: Standard hygiene tool, but can be used for lockpicking, cutting rope, or self-defense in tight spots.

item.name: Neural Disruptor Rod
entries: 1d4 psychic. Deals no physical damage but scrambles short-term memory on failed INT save. Used in black-site captures.

item.name: Night Vision Goggles (Gen 1)
entries: Bulky and green-tinted. Offers 60 ft. darkvision in dim or no light. Causes a soft electrical hum and lens static. Obstructs peripheral vision.

item.name: Night Vision Goggles (Gen 2)
entries: Bulky and green-tinted. Offers 60 ft. darkvision in dim or no light. Causes a soft electrical hum and lens static. Obstructs peripheral vision.

item.name: Notebook (Leatherbound)
entries: Filled with erratic handwriting, timestamps, or sketches. Ideal for keeping paranormal logs.

item.name: Nunchaku
entries: 1d6 bludgeoning. Requires finesse and training. Often handmade from old broom handles or riot baton parts.

item.name: Nylon Zip Ties
entries: Quiet restraints. Some jurisdictions call this an “unauthorized item.” They squeak when used near anomalies.

item.name: Occult Reference Binder
entries: 3-ring binder stuffed with printed PDFs, burned pages, and sticky notes. (Identify runes, quote chants, know cult symbology.)

item.name: Old Casino Chip
entries: Value: “$500.” No casino by that name exists anymore. Some say it can be traded with the dead.

item.name: Old Laptop (90s)
entries: Beige casing, DOS or early Windows. Takes minutes to boot and smells faintly of ozone.

item.name: Old Radio Ad Tapes
entries: Contain commercial messages for defunct products. Some reference people who never existed.

item.name: Old-School Bug Sweeper
entries: Detects analog wiretaps and radio transmitters in a 15 ft. radius. Emits pulses and static bursts.

item.name: Opera Tickets (Used)
entries: Torn stub to a performance that was canceled… or wasn’t.

item.name: Overhead Projector
entries: Standard classroom equipment. Hum and warmth of the bulb are oddly soothing.

item.name: Overhead Reel-to-Reel
entries: High-fidelity audio recorder. Used in interrogation rooms or paranormal logging stations.

item.name: Pack of Cigarettes (Smoked Halfway)
entries: 10 filtered smokes, mostly crushed. Brand: Empire Light. Warning label is scratched out.

item.name: Padded Undersuit
entries: Lightweight and flexible, worn beneath clothing. Offers minor impact resistance.

item.name: Pager
entries: Sends and receives numeric messages. Used by paramedics, dealers, and secretaries alike.

item.name: Paperweight
entries: Functional, featureless, and always just slightly too heavy to move comfortably.

item.name: Paperwork Kit
entries: File folders, stampers, white-out, outdated clearance forms, etc. (Forge documents, bypass bureaucratic checkpoints, influence bureaucrats.)

item.name: Parabolic Microphone
entries: Allows you to listen to distant sounds (up to 100 ft) if directional. Can’t isolate sound in noisy environments. Susceptible to anomaly interference.

item.name: Paracord Bracelet
entries: Unravels into 20 feet of cord. Stylish, practical, and often gifted to new recruits.

item.name: Penlight
entries: Small and discreet. Used in investigations, medical exams, or during stealth ops.

item.name: Pepper Spray
entries: Emits a burning chemical mist. Targets must succeed on a CON save or be blinded and incapacitated for 1 round.

item.name: Percolator Coffee (Burnt)
entries: Thick, tar-like sludge served in cracked mugs. Still more effective than a healing spell.

item.name: Celebrityl Massager (Vibe)
entries: Analog motor, loud. May have other uses (distraction device, nervous stim tool, spirit irritant).

item.name: Phantom Charge
entries: Invisible to the eye. Explodes on psychic proximity. Damage type: force or psychic (4d6). Often misidentified as faulty wiring.

item.name: Pipe Bomb
entries: Easy to build, unstable to store. Shrapnel-heavy. May detonate unpredictably if jostled.

item.name: Plasma Knuckles
entries: 1d4 fire + 1d4 thunder. Engulfs fists in crackling heat. Illegal, unstable, loud.

item.name: Plastique Sheet
entries: Thinner but wider-area version of C4. Used to collapse walls or compromise structures. Can be cut to size.

item.name: Playing Cards (Incomplete Deck)
entries: 47 cards. Some duplicates. The King of Hearts has no face.

item.name: Pocket Ashtray (Snapping Lid)
entries: Corporate-issued during the anti-smoking era. Closes with a satisfying click.

item.name: Pocket Mirror
entries: Unbreakable and tarnished. Good for peeking around corners—or checking for illusions.

item.name: Polaroid Camera
entries: Prints instant photos. Some claim certain anomalies don’t appear on the film.

item.name: Polaroid Spectroscope
entries: Captures images of energy fields when exposed for 10 seconds. Needs time to develop.

item.name: Polishing Rag (Clean)
entries: Used by janitors or agents with a badge obsession. Grants advantage to blend in with custodial staff.

item.name: Portable Boiler Coil
entries: Submerges in water and boils it in 60 seconds. Sparks in wet zones.

item.name: Punch Card Reader
entries: A holdover from early computing. Often still connected to security systems.

item.name: Pushpin Board
entries: Covered in memos, polaroids, and red yarn. The corkboard is brittle and patched.

item.name: Quarantine Suit (Medical)
entries: Designed for short-term exposure. Advantage on saves vs. disease or contact-based curses. Fragile—tears easily.

item.name: Radiation Suit (Mk I)
entries: Grants resistance to radiation effects. Can survive in irradiated zones for 1 hour. Glows faintly after use.

item.name: Radiation Suit (Mk III, Corporate)
entries: Used in old reactor zones. Grants resistance to radiation, force, and light-based anomaly effects. Must be pressurized every 30 minutes.

item.name: Radio
entries: A bulky analog receiver. Commonly used to monitor police bands or pirate frequencies.

item.name: Raffle Stub (Crinkled)
entries: From a forgotten community center. Prize never claimed. Ticket number: 01413.

item.name: Reinforced Bodysuit
entries: Layered synthetic fibers, common among field agents. Resistant to slashes and mild trauma.

item.name: Reinforced Cane (Concealed Blade)
entries: 1d6 piercing when deployed. Carried by agents in disguise.

item.name: Remote Demo Charge
entries: Modular explosive pack placed ahead of time and triggered remotely. Explosives can be customized by charge type.

item.name: Riot Baton (Telescoping)
entries: 1d6 bludgeoning, used by corporate security. Possibly grants disarm bonus.

item.name: Riot Foam Canister
entries: Explodes into expanding foam. Restrains all creatures in 10 ft. radius (DC 14 STR to escape). Often A.S.T.R.A.L. issue.

item.name: Riot Suppression Gear
entries: Heavy padding with shield rigging. Grants advantage on saving throws vs. forced movement.

item.name: Ritual Chalk (Government-Issued)
entries: White, dense, and non-toxic. Standard issue for field marking of unstable zones.

item.name: Ritual Dagger (Obsidian or Bone)
entries: 1d4 piercing, may be tied to anomalies or cultists.

item.name: Ritual Marking Set
entries: Chalk, charcoal, copper string, thread, incense, holy tape, and analog ritual tags. (Create glyphs, ward off anomalies, trace paranormal residue.)

item.name: Roofing Hatchet
entries: A small hatchet with a nail-puller hook. Used in construction and occasionally in conflict.

item.name: Rope (Industrial Nylon)
entries: Durable, fire-resistant, and oddly stiff. Common in maintenance crews.

item.name: Rope (Silk Bondage)
entries: 30 ft. of extremely durable silk rope. Can be used as escape line or artistic trap.

item.name: Rotary Phone
entries: A wall-mounted or desk phone with a heavy dial and a satisfying click. Occasionally rings without being plugged in.

item.name: Rubber Stamp (CLASSIFIED)
entries: Used in old archive departments. Somehow always has just enough ink. Might work on people’s memories.

item.name: Rusted Bayonet
entries: Once mounted on a rifle. Now rusted, jagged, and unnerving in appearance.

item.name: Rustroom Brew (Urban Shroom Tea)
entries: A strange blend found in Pariah hideouts. Supposed to help “see things as they are.”

item.name: Safety Signage (Metal)
entries: “Watch Your Step” and “Do Not Enter” signs are bolted to most surfaces.

item.name: Sai (Pair)
entries: 1d4 piercing. Can disarm. Used by stylized syndicate bodyguards or rogue agents.

item.name: Satchel Charge
entries: Carried in a canvas bag. Military-issue or black-market. Often used for sabotage, vehicles, or barricades.

item.name: Scratcher Coin (Bent)
entries: Used for lottery and ward-scraping rituals. Worn smooth on one side. Cold to the touch.

item.name: Security Badge Reader
entries: Access control unit. Some units retain logs far longer than they should.

item.name: Shaped Charge
entries: Concentrates blast in a specific direction. Used for tank armor, vaults, and reinforced barriers.

item.name: Shaving Kit (Well Used)
entries: Razor, brush, cream. Can be used for disguise prep or calming rituals.

item.name: Shock Baton
entries: 1d6 lightning + bludgeoning. Emits a high-pitched whine when armed. Used by security in suppression zones.

item.name: Shovel (Metal)
entries: Long reach, versatile. 1d8 bludgeoning/slashing. Can dig too.

item.name: Signal Detector (Sweep Wand)
entries: Detects hidden transmitters, bugs, or unusual electromagnetic fields. Analog needle that spikes erratically near anomalies.

item.name: Slap Charge (Magnetic)
entries: Small breaching device. Can be attached to doors or panels. Blows open surfaces with a 5 ft. radius force burst.

item.name: Sledgehammer
entries: 1d10 bludgeoning, slow but devastating.

item.name: Sleep Gas Canister
entries: All creatures in 10 ft. must CON save or fall unconscious for 1 minute. Popular among containment agents and rogue doctors.

item.name: Slide Carousel
entries: A rotating magazine for slide projectors. Occasionally skips to the wrong slide.

item.name: Slide Projector
entries: Used for lectures or training. Slides often found with scratched-out eyes or redacted info.

item.name: Slide Rule
entries: A pre-digital calculator. Used mostly by old-school engineers or archivists.

item.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: Creates a 10 ft. radius cloud of thick gray smoke. Heavily obscures area for 1 minute unless dispersed by wind.

item.name: Sonic Disruptor
entries: Emits a high-frequency pulse. All creatures in 20 ft. must save or become stunned for 1 round. May damage glass and eardrums.

item.name: Stab-Resistant Vest
entries: Designed to resist blades and shivs, not bullets. Lightweight and concealable.

item.name: Static Chainblade
entries: 2d6 slashing + lightning (once per long rest). Chainsaw sword powered by a sidepack battery. Sparks before every hit.

item.name: Steel Fan
entries: 1d4 slashing, concealable. Used in ritual duels and cult ceremonies. Can also deflect small projectiles.

item.name: Steel Filing Cabinet
entries: Heavy, lockable, with squeaky drawers. Most are bolted to the floor.

item.name: Steel Thermos
entries: Keeps coffee hot or soup cold. Some are custom-engraved by former agents.

item.name: Straight Razor
entries: A grooming tool with a flick-open blade. Often found in old barber kits.

item.name: Stun Gun
entries: Deals 1d4 lightning damage and may incapacitate a restrained target. Requires physical contact.

item.name: Tactical Sunglasses
entries: Reflective lenses, sturdy frame. Doubles as minor eye protection. Hides telltale glows from paranormal exposure.

item.name: Surveillance Kit
entries: Old bugging devices, cassette recorders, parabolic mics, reel-to-reel units. (Set up wiretaps, record anomalies, overhear secure conversations.)

item.name: Survival Knife
entries: Rugged and multipurpose, with a serrated back edge and built-in compass.

item.name: Survivalist Kit
entries: Gas mask, road flares, climbing line, utility knife, emergency ration paste. (For surviving in sealed or quarantined anomaly zones.)

item.name: Synthetic Cocoa (Powder Pack)
entries: Marketed to children of agents. Slightly chalky, occasionally nostalgic.

item.name: Tactical Vest (Level III)
entries: Includes utility pouches, trauma plates, and light modular shielding. Worn by corporate enforcers and riot teams.

item.name: Tanto (Short Blade)
entries: 1d6 piercing, finesse. Often kept in a boot sheath or briefcase lining.

item.name: Tape Measure (Metal Reel)
entries: Used for anomaly zone geometry. Auto-retracts when held over certain glyphs.

item.name: Tape Recorder (Mini)
entries: Pocket-sized and clicky. Used to take quick audio notes or record confessions. Requires cassette tapes.

item.name: Tape-Based Drone Controller
entries: Remote unit for controlling small drone using analog tapes and switches. 200 ft. range. Lags and jitters.

item.name: Taser Dart (Bayonet)
entries: 1d6 lightning, reach 5 ft. Wired to a belt pack. Can fire and retract, but misfires in wet conditions.

item.name: Tea Brick (Compressed)
entries: Requires boiling and scraping. Found in archival kits and travel lockers.

item.name: Tea Egg (Rusty)
entries: Still works, but adds a distinct iron taste.

item.name: Tear Gas Canister
entries: 15 ft. radius of irritant gas. Creatures inside must succeed on a CON save or gain Disadvantage on attacks and perception checks for 1 minute.

item.name: Temporal Blade (Prototype)
entries: 1d10 slashing + 1 CHA save vs. slow. Blade stutters in time. User ages 1 hour per strike. Not field-approved.

item.name: Hanheld Thermal Imager
entries: Requires 2-handed use. Detects body heat through walls or darkness in 30 ft. cone. Refresh rate is slow (every 6 seconds). Useless in high-heat environments.

item.name: Thermite Charge
entries: Burns through steel, concrete, or vault doors. No blast radius. Deals 3d8 fire damage over 3 rounds.

item.name: Thermobaric Charge
entries: Incendiary air-fuel mix. Sucks oxygen, then blasts with immense pressure. Used to clear bunkers.

item.name: Tire Iron
entries: Weighted and jagged. 1d6 bludgeoning, advantage on disabling vehicles.

item.name: Token (Game Hall)
entries: Heavy brass coin stamped with a neon arcade logo. Can be used in old machines or rituals of chance.

item.name: Tonfa (Police Batons)
entries: 1d6 bludgeoning, grants parry bonus. Originally riot gear, adapted by martial artists.

item.name: Trench Coat (Padded)
entries: Classic detective look. Lots of inner pockets. Treated to resist light rain and exposure to weird fluids.

item.name: Tuning Fork Blade
entries: 1d4 sonic damage when struck against surface first. Used against echo anomalies.

item.name: Turmeric Vine Tea (Traditional)
entries: Found in older cults and mystic families. Bright yellow with earthy, spiced bitterness. Can stain skin.

item.name: TV/VCR Combo
entries: A convenient unit found in hotel rooms and break rooms. Frequently hums even when unplugged.

item.name: Typewriter (Portable)
entries: Required for submitting A.S.T.R.A.L. field reports. Sometimes types words you didn’t intend.

item.name: Typewriter & Forge Stamp Set
entries: Used to create forged documents and match bureaucratic tone. (For convincing letters, orders, or evasion via red tape.)

item.name: Urban Scrapmail (Improvised)
entries: Pieced from old riot gear and scrap. Noisy. Often used by anarchists or Pariah enclaves.

item.name: Utility Blade
entries: Snap-off style cutting blade, often dulled and stained from use.

item.name: Velcro Wallet (Faded Logo)
entries: Contains a few receipts, old coupons, and a photo that’s been scratched out.

item.name: VHS Player
entries: A grainy, flickering video machine. Most tapes found are damaged, mislabeled, or unsettling.

item.name: Vibration Blade (Prototype)
entries: 1d6 slashing. Bypasses light armor due to high-frequency edge. Malfunctions possible.

item.name: Vintage Tea Set (Porcelain)
entries: Always seems out of place in bunkers or black sites. Cups chip easily. Teapot may whisper if left alone.

item.name: Void Suit (Outdated Prototype)
entries: Sealed airtight suit meant for anomalous “vacuum zones.” Muffles all sound. Only functions 1 hour per charge. Known to malfunction in eerie ways.

item.name: Vortex Halberd
entries: 1d12 force. Contains a miniature gravity inverter. Pulls nearby matter into the swing. Sometimes shrieks when idle.

item.name: Wall Clock (Analog)
entries: Ticks loudly. Always slightly out of sync with reality—or with other clocks in the building.

item.name: Wall-Mounted Intercom
entries: A common feature in residential buildings. Voices sometimes echo from the wrong floor.

item.name: Water Cooler (Jug Style)
entries: Dispenses lukewarm or suspiciously cold water. The hum is constant.

item.name: Whispering Chamber
entries: Silent fire; DC 15 WIS save or hear death whispers.

item.name: Wool Gloves (Dark Gray)
entries: Helps with grip and leaves no fingerprints. Dampens tremors from eldritch cold.

item.name: Wrench (Large/Heavy)
entries: Common for mechanics and saboteurs. 1d6 bludgeoning, possibly counts as a tool.

item.name: Zippo Lighter
entries: Brass and refillable. Often engraved. The flame never flickers in the wind.

item.name: A.S.T.R.A.L. Incident Report (Form X-17B)
entries: A manila folder stamped “CONFIDENTIAL”. Filling out the report with an entity’s name and incident details causes reality to alter slightly, classifying the target as an *“anomalous occurrence”* in all official records. As long as the report remains in the folder, the target is ignored by automated systems, security patrols, and corporate bureaucracies.

item.name: Ashen Draught of the Forgotten Soul
entries: A potion of pale, smoky fluid, contained in a bottle with no label. Drinking it removes all traces of the drinker’s existence from recorded history for 1 hour—documents, surveillance, even divination magic will show nothing of them. The effect does not erase memory, but those who knew the drinker will feel an uncanny sense that something is missing, unable to place why. Once the hour ends, their presence returns to reality as if nothing had happened.

item.name: Breath of the Night Sky
entries: A deep blue liquid with tiny specks of light, resembling the night sky. When consumed, the user breathes out a mist of starlight that illuminates invisible creatures and reveals hidden doorways within a 30-foot radius for 1 minute. The mist clings to things unseen, making them shimmer like constellations.

item.name: Celestial Lattice Pearl
entries: A smooth white pearl, faintly humming with divine resonance. Swallowing it allows the user to resist death once—if they drop to 0 HP within the next 24 hours, they automatically stabilize at 1 HP and gain temporary damage resistance to all sources for 1 minute. The pearl dissolves upon use.

item.name: Crimson Tear of the Phoenix
entries: A small vial of deep red liquid, warm as fresh blood. Drinking it fully restores all hit points, removes all conditions, and cures all diseases. However, its true power lies in its lingering effect—if the drinker dies within the next minute, they are instantly reborn in a burst of flame, returning to life with full health. The potion only works once per person—if they drink it again, they will not return upon death.

item.name: Draught of the Eternal Mirage
entries: A swirling gold and blue liquid, shifting as if it were made of liquid glass. Drinking it creates an illusory duplicate of the user that moves independently, mimicking their intent rather than their exact actions. The illusion lasts for 5 minutes and cannot be dispelled by normal means.

item.name: Draught of the Final Hour
entries: A thin, silver liquid stored in a flawless glass vial. When consumed, time slows to a crawl, granting the drinker one full extra round before time resumes normally. However, once the effect ends, the user must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion, as their body struggles to catch up with reality.

item.name: Echo-Wine of the Fallen
entries: A dark silver-hued wine, stored in an old elven bottle with no label. Drinking it allows the user to fully experience the last 10 minutes of a deceased person’s life, including their thoughts, emotions, and sensations. The experience is intensely real, and if the death was traumatic, the user must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed in horror for 1 minute.

item.name: Elixir of Echoing Footsteps
entries: A clear liquid in a silver flask, rippling slightly as if something unseen moves within it. Drinking it causes the user’s past self to walk beside them, leaving behind phantom footsteps and confusing pursuers. For 1 hour, all attempts to track the user fail automatically, as their path is littered with illusory trails leading in different directions.

item.name: Elixir of Lingering Echoes
entries: A swirling violet liquid, faintly humming with whispered voices. Drinking it allows the user to leave behind an echo of themselves, which continues performing the last action they took for the next 10 seconds. This can be used to create illusory diversions, false movements, or repeating attacks. The echo is not sentient, but it is perfectly accurate in mimicking the user’s last action.

item.name: Elixir of Rewoven Flesh
entries: A viscous, silver liquid, which slithers inside its vial as if alive. Drinking it restores 6d6 hit points and can reconstruct lost limbs or organs over the course of an hour. However, the regrown flesh feels slightly off, unnaturally smooth or lacking scars the user once had.

item.name: Elixir of the Fading Breath
entries: A clear colorless liquid that feels like air itself when swallowed. Drinking it causes the user to become almost non-existent for 5 minutes—they cannot be heard, smelled, or sensed by any means except sight. During this time, the user cannot make sound or interact with objects directly, but they may walk through light obstacles as if slipping between reality’s cracks.

item.name: Form 77B-Theta: Request for Removal
entries: A bureaucratic form requesting the erasure of an anomaly. If a creature’s full name is written on the form and submitted into a file cabinet, the target becomes "pending removal" for 24 hours. During this time, security systems, surveillance, and bureaucratic records will no longer register their existence. The creature can still interact with the world, but official documents will treat them as an unperson, unable to buy, sell, or prove they exist. After 24 hours, reality reasserts itself, and all records return as normal.

item.name: Ghostwrite Ink
entries: A glass inkwell containing shifting, silvery ink. Anything written with this ink will appear in an official record somewhere in the city, altering logs, ledgers, and minutes of meetings. The change lasts for 24 hours before correcting itself, leaving only faint discrepancies behind.

item.name: Gilded Wine of the Sleeping Realm
entries: A golden-hued wine, its surface shimmering with faint, dreamlike images. Drinking it instantly puts the user into a controlled sleep, during which they may explore the dreams of those nearby for up to 1 hour. While dreaming, they can communicate, influence, or observe the thoughts of another sleeping mind. The effect ends instantly if the user is awakened.

item.name: Ink of the Unwritten Oath
entries: A thick, black ink, bottled in a glass vial sealed with wax. Drinking it binds the user to a promise—the first vow they make aloud within the next minute becomes magically unbreakable. If they try to break the vow, they suffer 6d10 psychic damage and are compelled to fulfill the promise until death.

item.name: Lament of the Nameless Dead
entries: A thin, blue liquid, humming faintly with sorrowful whispers. Drinking it allows the user to temporarily recall a forgotten soul, summoning their ghost for one minute. The spirit has no memories of who they were, only lingering emotions and vague echoes of their past life.

item.name: Lifeblood Ambrosia
entries: A golden liquid, tasting of honey and warm sunlight. Drinking it restores 8d8 hit points and extends the user’s lifespan by 1 year. However, each time the potion is consumed, the user must forget a single name, chosen at random from their memories.

item.name: Liqueur of Stolen Time
entries: A crystalline vial filled with a golden, swirling fluid. Drinking it steals the next 10 minutes of time from a willing creature within 30 feet, adding that time to the drinker’s own lifespan. This extends their life, but the stolen time can never be returned, and the victim instinctively knows something was taken.

item.name: Neon Halo
entries: A flickering neon sign shaped like a ring, detached from its original mounting. When placed on a surface, it floats slightly and emits a soft glow. When worn above the head, it projects an aura of influence, making the user appear more important than they are. Creatures of equal or lower status instinctively defer to the wearer, treating them as if they belong in high-ranking circles. However, prolonged use causes electrical disturbances and flickering lights within a 30-foot radius.

item.name: Phantom's Breath
entries: A pale blue vapor, swirling inside a sealed bottle. Drinking it allows the user to become completely intangible for 30 seconds, allowing them to walk through walls, avoid attacks, and phase through obstacles. They cannot interact with the physical world while intangible.

item.name: Phantom’s Embrace
entries: A bottle of pale, milky fluid, faintly glowing in dim light. Drinking it allows the user to become incorporeal for 10 minutes, passing through solid objects and ignoring non-magical attacks. However, during this time, spirits can touch them freely, whispering secrets or leaving behind lingering sensations.

item.name: Punch Clock of Endless Shifts
entries: A battered time clock, still attached to a fragment of a concrete wall. When used to “clock in,” the user enters a temporary pocket of stagnation where time moves differently. The next hour passes in mere seconds for the user, allowing them to perform mundane tasks (such as repairing equipment or analyzing documents) at unnatural speed. However, using the clock more than once per day causes time desynchronization—roll 1d20; on a 1, the user loses 1d4 hours without memory of the passage of time.

item.name: Redacted Badge
entries: A security ID with all details permanently blacked out. When worn, it grants the user the ability to walk into any secured area as though they belong there. This effect lasts for up to 10 minutes or until someone directly questions the user’s presence, at which point the badge becomes useless for the remainder of the day.

item.name: Resonant Amber of the Old Song
entries: A chunk of crystallized amber, humming with a low, musical vibration. When chewed, the user’s voice resonates with ancient tones, allowing them to speak in a way that all creatures understand, bypassing language barriers for 10 minutes. Additionally, the user gains advantage on Charisma-based checks while the effect lasts, their voice sounding more captivating and authoritative.

item.name: Salt of the Unbroken Circle
entries: A small pinch of silvered salt, stored in an obsidian vial. Sprinkling it in a circle creates a perfect barrier for 10 minutes—no creature, spirit, or magic can cross it unless the circle is broken. Consuming it makes the user immune to possession, charm effects, and external control for 1 hour.

item.name: Soulmirror Draught
entries: A mercurial silver fluid, rippling with faint reflections of faces that aren’t the drinker’s. Drinking it allows the user to assume the appearance of a specific ghost for 1 hour, imitating their voice, mannerisms, and even aura. However, the more powerful the ghost, the stronger its influence over the drinker, potentially overwriting their will for the duration.

item.name: Telepathic Tape Recorder
entries: A bulky cassette recorder with an input jack but no microphone. It records thoughts instead of sound, transcribing them onto magnetic tape. The user can rewind and play back a recording, allowing them to replay up to 10 minutes of recent thought activity. Extracted thoughts fade after 24 hours, becoming garbled whispers.

item.name: The Amulet of Undisputed Ownership
entries: A golden pendant, engraved with no name, yet its aura radiates authority. When worn, any object held or touched by the bearer is considered theirs—others instinctively hesitate before taking anything from them, even in self-defense. If removed, the wearer must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or be unable to understand the concept of "sharing" ever again.

item.name: The Analog Anomaly Pill
entries: A strange, dull metal pill, humming with faint static. Swallowing it shifts the user into a retro-futuristic version of reality, causing all technology around them to de-age to an outdated, analog state for 1 hour. Modern devices turn into vacuum tubes, cassette tapes, and mainframe consoles, and digital data becomes physically written on punch cards or paper printouts. However, the effect is unstable—once it ends, some devices may retain their altered state permanently.

item.name: The Analog Soul Infusion
entries: A strange fluid, shifting between black ink and flickering CRT static. Drinking it allows the user to upload a copy of their consciousness into an electronic device, creating a temporary AI construct of themselves that lasts until the device is shut down. However, if the construct remains active for too long, the user must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or risk losing a part of their celebritylity permanently.

item.name: The Ancestral Echo
entries: A small, smooth stone that echoes with countless voices when held. Once per long rest, the user may call upon an ancestor, asking them one question. However, the voice that answers is not always the one that was called.

item.name: The Anomaly-Laced Tape Reel
entries: A reel of magnetic tape that records voices that were never spoken. When played, it overlays reality with an alternative conversation, making the listener believe events unfolded differently. The user may rewrite up to 5 minutes of past conversation, causing creatures present to remember the new version as real. This effect persists unless challenged with solid evidence.

item.name: The Armor of Sighs
entries: This armor appears normal, save for the soft sighs it emits when touched. When worn, it grants +3 AC and immunity to charm effects, but it also whispers constantly—soft breaths, longing moans, and quiet pleas. Once per day, the wearer may force a creature within 30 feet to make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become overwhelmed with an unexplainable yearning, unable to focus on combat for 1 minute. However, the armor demands attention—if the wearer does not touch or interact with it for a full day, they must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or suffer 1d6 psychic damage from the suffocating silence.

item.name: The Ash of a Broken Oath
entries: A pinch of gray ash, kept in a sealed glass vial. Inhaling it allows the user to track a broken promise—they instinctively know the direction of the last person who betrayed them within 1 mile. If the oath-breaker is within range, the user feels their heartbeat in their own chest.

item.name: The Ash of a Vanished City
entries: A pinch of black ash, stored in a small silver case. Swallowing it grants a vision of a city that no longer exists, as it was in its final moments. The user experiences everything as if they were physically there, including the sights, sounds, and emotions of those present before it disappeared. This knowledge often reveals forgotten history or secrets erased from time.

item.name: The Ash That Remembers Fire
entries: A small handful of cold, black ash that, when scattered, replays the last moments of what burned to create it. The visions are vivid and unrelenting, showing not just fire, but the pain, fear, and regret of whatever was lost.

item.name: The Ashen Draught
entries: A charcoal-colored liquid, thick like smoke trapped in glass. Drinking it renders the user immune to fire and heat for 10 minutes, including lava, magical fire, and burning environments. However, the effect prevents natural warmth—they feel cold to the touch, and their breath becomes visible as if in freezing air.

item.name: The Ashen Remedy
entries: A bottle of thick gray liquid, smelling of smoke and burnt herbs. Drinking it removes all diseases, poisons, and infections but leaves the user ashen-skinned and fatigued for 1 hour. During this time, they have disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity checks, as if their body is slowly recovering from the flames.

item.name: The Beckoning Shadow
entries: A shadow that does not belong to its owner. It moves slightly out of sync, flickers unnaturally, and sometimes appears to look back at them. Once per day, the user may step into their shadow, vanishing into complete darkness for up to 1 minute. While inside, they are untouchable—but each use gives the shadow more autonomy. If used more than three times, the shadow does not return when they step out, continuing to move on its own.

item.name: The Bell That Rings for You
entries: A small, silver bell, engraved with names that shift constantly. When rung, it calls forth someone who owes the user a debt, compelling them to return and repay it. However, the bell tracks all debts, including those of the ringer. Each time it is used, another name appears on the bell’s surface—the user’s own name, growing larger each time, until one day, they are the one who must answer its call.

item.name: The Bell That Rings in the Beyond
entries: A small silver bell, inscribed with unknown runes. Ringing it summons a random spirit from the afterlife, which appears within 30 feet. The summoned ghost is never predictable—it could be friendly, hostile, or something else entirely.

item.name: The Binding Cord
entries: A thin white thread, cold and humming with latent magic. Swallowing it allows the user to bind a spirit to their presence for 24 hours, preventing it from fading or moving beyond 30 feet. The spirit remains aware of the effect and may not appreciate being forced to stay.

item.name: The Biomechanical Extract
entries: A viscous blue liquid, thick like living mercury. Drinking it temporarily fuses the user’s body with machinery, allowing them to interface directly with electronic devices and weapons for 10 minutes. However, when the effect ends, the user must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or retain small mechanical elements, such as metallic veins or digitized pupils, for the next 24 hours.

item.name: The Black Barrel Manifest
entries: A massive, ancient shotgun, carved with impossible geometric symbols. When fired, it does not shoot lead, but instead releases a blast of unreality, forcing all creatures within 20 feet to make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they experience a different version of themselves from an alternate timeline, causing 1d6 psychic damage for each unrealized future they glimpse.

item.name: The Blade of Breathing Skin
entries: This sword feels alive, its hilt warm and pulsing like flesh. When drawn, it exhales a soft, heated breath, and when it strikes a target, the wound twitches and shivers, as if craving more. Each time the blade lands a critical hit, the wielder must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or feel their own skin begin to crawl and shift, as if something beneath is trying to emerge.

item.name: The Blade of Forgotten Oaths
entries: This sword remembers betrayals. Each time it strikes a creature who has broken a vow, promise, or contract, it deals an additional 2d10 psychic damage. However, the blade feeds on its wielder's own forgotten sins—once attuned, the user must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw each dawn. On a failure, they forget one past promise they made, never realizing they once swore it.

item.name: The Blade of Unspoken Promises
entries: A dagger with no reflection. Each time it cuts a target, the wielder may whisper a promise into the wound, and the target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or believe the promise to be unbreakable truth. If the wielder ever breaks the promise, the dagger turns on them, seeking their own blood.

item.name: The Blood-Slick Coin
entries: A small copper coin, warm as living flesh. Swallowing it allows the user to trade their life for another—if a nearby creature dies within the next minute, the user may exchange their own vitality, causing the slain creature to revive while the user takes their place in death.

item.name: The Bloodletting Tincture
entries: A small vial of silver fluid, turning red upon contact with flesh. Drinking it immediately removes all poisons and diseases, but the user bleeds uncontrollably for 1 minute, losing 1d4 HP per round. A bandage or magical healing stops the effect early, but without treatment, the cure is as dangerous as the affliction.

item.name: The Bone of a Forgotten God
entries: A massive, hollow bone, too large to be from any known creature. When held, it hums faintly with a heartbeat that is not your own. Placing an ear to the bone allows the user to hear whispers from an ancient being—a deity long erased from history. The more the user listens, the louder the whispers become.

item.name: The Boneflower Remedy
entries: A small, pure white flower, cold to the touch. Eating it instantly heals all broken bones and fractures, but causes the user to feel numb and disconnected from their body for 10 minutes. During this time, pain ceases to exist, but neither does sensation.

item.name: The Book That Reads the Reader
entries: A leather-bound tome with no title and no visible text—until it is opened. Each time a reader turns a page, the book writes something new—a past memory, a private thought, a secret only they could know. Once per day, the reader may ask the book a question, and it will reveal a truth—but each answer costs a forgotten part of the reader’s own past, taken and rewritten elsewhere. In time, the book knows more about the reader than they do themselves.

item.name: The Book That Reads You
entries: A leather-bound tome with no title and no known author. When opened, its pages begin filling with text, describing the reader’s thoughts, memories, and fears in real-time. If the book is read for more than 10 minutes, it begins to reveal secrets even the reader did not know, exposing events that may not have happened—yet.

item.name: The Boots That Leave No Footprints
entries: A pair of soft leather boots, silent as shadows. While worn, the user’s steps make no sound, and they leave behind no tracks. However, the boots erase more than just footprints. Over time, people begin to forget the wearer’s presence—at first, strangers fail to notice them, then friends fail to remember them, and finally, even their own reflection refuses to show them. After one year, the wearer must make a DC 19 Charisma saving throw each day or be permanently erased from reality.

item.name: The Boots That Never Stop Walking
entries: A pair of black leather boots, always a perfect fit. When worn, they double the wearer’s walking speed and allow them to ignore exhaustion from travel. However, the wearer must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw each dawn or be compelled to keep walking, unable to stop unless physically restrained. Each failed save increases the compulsion’s strength—after seven failures, the wearer can never stop again, walking endlessly until their body collapses.

item.name: The Bottle of Borrowed Time
entries: A delicate glass vial, containing a swirling, golden mist. Drinking it allows the user to relive the last minute of their life exactly as it happened, as if rewinding time. However, others will still remember the original sequence of events, making it clear that something unnatural has occurred.

item.name: The Bracelet of Perfect Blood
entries: A thin golden band, deceptively simple but unmistakably noble. While worn, the bearer always appears as the most refined version of themselves, flawless and superior. Non-elves who wear it must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw each dawn or suffer 1d6 necrotic damage, as their impure blood attempts to reshape itself into something better. The bracelet rejects the unworthy—if worn for too long, it begins draining away anything that does not fit its definition of perfection.

item.name: The Breath of Distant Stars
entries: A vial of sparkling mist, tasting of cold night air. Drinking it allows the user to speak and understand the language of any celestial being for 1 hour, as if they had always known it. During this time, their voice echoes faintly, and their eyes glow with a shifting, otherworldly light.

item.name: The Breath of the Departed
entries: A delicate pearl, containing the last breath of a dying person. Swallowing it grants knowledge of one thing the deceased knew in life, but the memory is fragmented and incomplete. Once used, the user feels a lingering coldness in their chest for 24 hours, as if the spirit still lingers inside them.

item.name: The Breath of the Sleeping Gods
entries: A vial of swirling blue mist, constantly shifting between liquid and vapor. Drinking it places the user into a deep, death-like sleep for 1 hour. When they awaken, they are fully restored, as if having completed a long rest, and any wounds, curses, or afflictions are completely gone. However, they awaken with a vivid vision of something ancient watching them.

item.name: The Breath of the Vanished Gods
entries: A bottle of thick, blue mist, shifting like the dawn sky. Drinking it momentarily turns the user into an ethereal being, letting them drift through walls, across dimensions, and into the hidden spaces between reality for one minute. However, ancient, forgotten gods may take notice, whispering their forgotten names into the drinker’s soul.

item.name: The Bullet That Remembers
entries: A simple lead bullet, humming softly when touched. Once fired, it remains in existence, endlessly returning to the shooter’s pocket at the start of each day. However, each time it is used to kill, the shooter begins to remember a life they never lived, suffering disadvantage on Insight and Intelligence checks for 24 hours as memories of another timeline bleed through.

item.name: The Cage of Wanting Steel
entries: A suit of armor that locks into place, securing the wearer so tightly they can barely move. It grants +4 AC and immunity to psychic damage, but prevents the wearer from taking the Dash or Disengage actions. Once per long rest, the wearer may choose to surrender—becoming completely still for 1 minute, during which time they cannot be harmed. Afterward, however, the armor remembers the surrender—and each time it is used, it becomes harder to move, the steel tightening with an almost pleasurable finality.

item.name: The Candle of Endless Yearning
entries: A melted candle that, when lit, fills the air with desire. All creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or become momentarily overwhelmed with longing, fixating on something or someone they crave. The candle never burns out, but each use makes the desires it stirs stronger, and harder to control.

item.name: The Candle of the Forgotten Soul
entries: A small wax candle, its flame burning a deep blue. Lighting it allows the user to speak with a long-dead soul, calling their spirit forth from the veil of oblivion for five minutes. However, the candle’s flame does not go out on its own—once lit, the summoned spirit chooses when it is finished speaking.

item.name: The Candle of the Sleepless Watcher
entries: A thin white candle, its flame never flickering no matter the wind. When burned, it keeps everyone within 30 feet awake, preventing sleep, magical slumber, or unconsciousness for 8 hours. If left burning for the full duration, the user may glimpse something moving just outside their field of vision, though they will never fully see what it is.

item.name: The Candle of the Veiled Watcher
entries: A small black candle, flickering with an invisible flame. Lighting it allows the user to see a hidden specter that has been observing them, if one exists. The ghost cannot harm them directly but will react to being revealed, for better or worse.

item.name: The Candle of the Wandering Mind
entries: A thin white candle, its flame flickering even without wind. Burning it while sleeping sends the user’s consciousness drifting, allowing them to observe the dreams of strangers within 1 mile. However, they cannot control where they go—some dreams may be mundane, while others may reveal unsettling truths.

item.name: The Candle of Unkind Mercy
entries: A short, crimson candle, its wax dripping upward instead of down. Lighting it instantly stabilizes all dying creatures within 30 feet, preventing them from passing beyond death’s threshold. However, each creature saved must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be permanently weakened, their life force scarred from being forced back.

item.name: The Candle That Burns Backward
entries: A melted candle that never drips wax. When lit, time reverses in a small area for as long as the flame remains burning. If the candle burns for more than 10 minutes, it begins to undo reality itself, causing people to forget why they exist.

item.name: The Candle That Burns Time
entries: A half-melted candle, its flame unnaturally bright. When lit, it grants the user an additional action per turn, allowing them to move and act with unnatural speed. However, for each minute burned, the user loses one hour of their life—memories, relationships, and even entire days erased as if they never existed. If the candle ever burns completely, the user’s entire existence is undone, leaving behind no trace they were ever born.

item.name: The Chain of Submission
entries: This iron-linked whip wraps around the target and whispers soft commands that cannot be ignored. On a hit, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or be unable to attack the wielder until they take damage from another source. The whip likes to be held, and it wraps itself around the wielder’s arm at night, refusing to be removed unless the wielder succeeds on a DC 18 Strength saving throw.

item.name: The Chain That Binds No One
entries: A length of silver chain, cold as regret. When wrapped around a creature, it binds them in place, preventing all movement. However, when used too many times, the chain’s power turns inward, binding the user to the one they have captured the most. The next time the chain is used, the wielder must make a DC 19 Charisma saving throw or become permanently bound to their prisoner, unable to leave their side for the rest of their days.

item.name: The Chained God’s Offering
entries: A silver liquid, shimmering with golden runes that flicker like trapped fireflies. Drinking it binds the user’s fate to a celestial power, granting divine insight and the ability to hear the voices of angels for 24 hours. However, any lie spoken during this time instantly sears the tongue, and the user loses 1d4 HP per deception. If the effect lasts too long, angels may take interest, demanding further devotion.

item.name: The Chains of Longing
entries: This whip is woven from braided strands of silver and something softer, almost organic. When it strikes a creature, it leaves behind a lingering sensation, as if hands are still touching them. Once per day, the wielder may cause the chains to wrap around a target’s wrists or throat, forcing them to make a DC 18 Charisma saving throw or become unable to take any hostile action for 1 minute, overwhelmed by a mix of desire, submission, or fascination.

item.name: The Chains of Willing Flesh
entries: A set of metal rings and chains, somehow warm to the touch. When donned, the chains tighten to fit perfectly, wrapping around limbs, throat, and chest in a way that feels almost intimate. The armor grants resistance to all physical damage, but its curse ensures that the wearer cannot remove it without help—it requires another person’s hands to unlock and unbind it. If left unworn for more than a day, the chains begin to rattle in the night, calling the wearer back.

item.name: The Chalice of Endless Favor
entries: A jewel-encrusted goblet, impossibly valuable yet never empty. When raised in a toast, it grants the drinker a favor from those who hear it, forcing creatures within 30 feet to make a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or feel obligated to grant the bearer one request. However, those who drink from the chalice lose something in return—a memory, a feeling, or a moment of dignity, all absorbed by the goblet’s magic.

item.name: The Chime of Moonlit Slumber
entries: A small silver bell, with no visible clapper inside. Ringing it induces a deep, restful sleep in all willing creatures within 30 feet. Those who sleep under its influence experience the same dream, allowing for shared visions, memories, or subconscious messages.

item.name: The Chime That Breaks the Silence
entries: A small metal chime, ringing only once before crumbling into dust. Striking it disrupts all silence within 60 feet, instantly breaking magical silence, sound-dampening effects, and any attempt to suppress speech or sound. Creatures affected by silence must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be momentarily stunned by the sudden flood of noise.

item.name: The Cloak of Entitlement
entries: A long, velvet-lined cloak, its edges threaded with platinum. While worn, the bearer is instinctively obeyed by those of lower social standing, who must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw to resist subtle compulsion. However, the cloak demands constant validation—if the wearer ever goes a full day without being publicly praised or acknowledged, they suffer 1d10 psychic damage, growing desperate for recognition.

item.name: The Cloak of the Ascended Lineage
entries: A glimmering white cloak, woven from the hair of long-dead elven rulers. While worn, the bearer cannot be mistaken for a commoner—all who see them instinctively recognize them as noble, powerful, and above reproach. They gain advantage on Persuasion checks, and non-elves must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw to argue against them. However, the cloak rejects lesser bloodlines—non-elves must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw each dawn or suffer 1d10 necrotic damage, as the cloak strips away their unworthy essence.

item.name: The Coat of Endless Wealth
entries: A lavish velvet coat, lined with silken thread spun from gold. While worn, the user finds gold coins in its pockets each morning, seemingly without end. However, the gold is never truly theirs—it is taken from somewhere else, vanishing from vaults, purses, and treasuries across the world. After one month, the wearer begins to see beggars where there were none, hear whispers of missing fortunes, and feel unseen hands reaching into their own pockets. After one year, the coat no longer produces gold—instead, it takes it, ensuring the wearer is never wealthy again.

item.name: The Coffin-Binder’s Draught
entries: A sepia-hued liquid, thick like grave soil. Drinking it allows the user to return from death once—if they die within the next 24 hours, they automatically stabilize and rise with half their hit points. However, they return marked by the grave, becoming permanently colder to the touch, and undead creatures recognize them as kin.

item.name: The Coin of Unfinished Wagers
entries: A thin gold leaf, shaped like a coin, dissolving into the mouth with a faint metallic taste. For the next hour, any gamble, wager, or game of chance the user participates in tilts slightly in their favor—dice seem to land well, cards fall as they need, and merchants hesitate before refusing deals. The effect is subtle, but undeniable.

item.name: The Coin That Chooses Fate
entries: An ancient copper coin, engraved with two shifting faces. When flipped, it answers any yes-or-no question with absolute certainty. However, each flip changes reality—the world subtly shifts to ensure the answer is true, often in unexpected and catastrophic ways. The more it is used, the more reality bends around the coin’s choices, until the user no longer recognizes the world they live in.

item.name: The Coin That Collects Debts
entries: A gold coin with no markings, smooth to the touch. When pressed into someone’s palm, they instinctively feel they owe something to the giver. Once per day, the bearer can call in a debt, forcing a creature to make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or feel compelled to repay what they "owe", even if nothing was ever borrowed. If the coin is used too often, it begins demanding debt from the wielder, whispering in the night, reminding them of things they have taken and never returned.

item.name: The Coin That Shouldn’t Exist
entries: A rusted coin with no markings. When flipped, it never lands—it simply vanishes, reappearing somewhere nearby within 24 hours. Each time it is used, something minor in the world changes, unnoticed by all but the user.

item.name: The Coin That Speaks in Tongues
entries: A heavy platinum coin, its surface worn smooth from generations of hoarding. When held, it whispers softly, speaking the names of deals brokered and fortunes lost. If spent, the coin forces the recipient to agree to a favorable trade, granting advantage on Persuasion checks when negotiating wealth or property. However, the coin always returns to its owner within 24 hours, often at the cost of something else mysteriously vanishing in return.

item.name: The Coinpurse That Devours Generosity
entries: A fine silk purse, always full—no matter how much is spent, it refills itself overnight, ensuring the owner never feels the burden of scarcity. However, it hates charity. If the owner ever gives away their wealth without expecting return, the purse seals shut until something is taken by force. Those who carry it find themselves reluctant to part with even the smallest coin, hoarding endlessly while the purse feeds on their greed.

item.name: The Collar of Echoing Devotion
entries: A smooth, silver collar that locks into place when worn. It grants advantage on Charisma checks and makes the wearer immune to fear, but at a cost. Once attuned, the wearer hears a voice—soft, familiar, and achingly affectionate. It speaks only to them, whispering encouragement, desire, and endless devotion. If the collar is ever removed, the voice turns bitter, demanding to know why it was abandoned.

item.name: The Compass That Finds Nothing
entries: A brass compass, its needle always spinning. When held, it points toward the last thing the user truly desired—a lost treasure, a person, a long-forgotten dream. However, each time it is used, the user must make a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw or begin to doubt what they truly wanted in the first place. After three failures, the compass’s direction no longer makes sense—pointing toward places that have never existed, leading its bearer ever onward, toward nothing.

item.name: The Corset of Submission
entries: A beautifully crafted corset laced with silver thread, its boning reinforced with something organic. When worn, it grants +2 AC and advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks, but tightens each time the wearer resists an order. If the wearer refuses a direct command three times in one day, they must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or become incapacitated for 1d4 rounds, overwhelmed by the crushing embrace of the corset.

item.name: The Crimson Eclipse Elixir
entries: A deep red liquid, swirling with flecks of gold that move like tiny eyes within the potion. Drinking it grants immunity to all damage for 1 minute, but when the effect ends, the drinker immediately takes 50 damage as their body violently recalibrates to reality.
